Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vsattui123
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to stay. The price is right and the location is good. The motel is one block north of Duval but on the east side of the town. The nice thing about this is that you are away from the hustle of Duval but yet it is close enough that it is an easy walk to get to the heart of Duval. The motel itself is well kept. The rooms are clean and comfortable. There are approximately 60 rooms. The breakfast is included in the room price. They have a very nice variety of breakfast items. The pool/hot tub is a good size and well maintained. We interacted with several of the staff and everyone was every nice. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Key West, good stay”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGi
Reviews.Content: The place is good for a stay in Key West. Avery short walk away from Duval Street and the restaurants and less than 5 minutes walk from the closest beach. Room was immaculate, big and comfy and there is a big swimming pool in the middle of the place. Overall a good place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/motel”
Reviews.Author: Violeta K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for 1 night, but it was lovely. Free parking, nice breakfast, not too many place to eat breakfast though. Nice heated pool, spaciuos rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Super. Nice LARGE rooms, and near everything!”
Reviews.Author: Roger D
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel. 5 min walk to the most southern point and 20 minutes walk to the touristic area. Clean rooms, really large. Enough parking space. Will go again. Breakfast area was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced ..... college students control pool area”
Reviews.Author: michtravel42763
Reviews.Content: Our one night 03/11/12 at $282.49 total and you get location, not comfort. College students controlled pool & hot tub. Over 2 hours playing beer pong in the pool using 2 float lounges with table connected over them and spilling beer into pool while management notices but ignores situation. Room was typical (nice) Best Western. Keep in mind if you book here, this is a motel,not a hotel or resort. I only rate this a 2-1/2 star rating motel at best. You expect much more class from a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Def stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Jillsand1
Reviews.Content: People there r so friendly.. Great continental breakfast, nice roomy rooms..locks and doors a little sticky so hard to open but could be to the humidity. My only personal complant is beds not comfy but great pillows and showers.Pool clean. Front desk is awesome!!! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “I was a hero for my group”
Reviews.Author: ICEMANVN
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for our trip , upon arrival even though I forgot to request a handicap room , but the receptionist saw our disability decay he automatic gave us 2 rooms with handicapped access , the room are nice and very big , we all enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprising place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Ironmanvol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ventured on a three day - two night visit to Key West, having no idea what it would be like. We had a very enjoyable trip, and the BW Hibiscus played a big role in our positive experience there. It is not a 5 star hotel, but I rated it 5 dots when compared with similar motels in that style and price range. In fact, the price was more than reasonable when compared to other places in Key West, and on top of that, it included free parking, WiFi, and breakfast. If you have not visited Key West, here is a little info that might help you decide where to stay. There are many small, medium and large hotels in the â€œdowntownâ€� area. There are also lots of cute cottage style B&Bs. In addition, there are a number of hotels away from downtown - especially in the airport area. These hotels are too far from the bars, shops etc. to walk. You will either need to drive, or take a cab. Parking in downtown Key West is hard to come by, and usually is pretty expensive, unless you luck into a rare free space. The hard-to-find meters go for about $1.50 per hour, I think. On the other hand, if you stay at the BW Hibiscus, parking is free there, and the spaces are easily accessed and ample in number as far as I could tell. The BW Hibiscus is located on the south end of town very near South Point. It is a block east of the main drag, Duval Street, which runs north-south. The rowdy end of Duval is the north end from about 0 (the pier area) to 600 Duval Street. The BW Hibiscus is located about 1.1 mile from the pier at the southernmost end of Simonton Street, just one block east of Duval Street. Although there are shops and bars all along Duval (and some of the other streets as well), you will walk about 0.6 mile from the BW Hibiscus to where the â€œactionâ€� starts on Duval. Plan to walk a lot and wear comfy shoes. The south end of town appeared fairly quiet, and a good nightâ€™s sleep should not be in jeopardy at the BW Hibiscus. The hotel itself is clean and freshly painted on the outside. It was being painted during our stay on Valentineâ€™s Day 2012, but there were no problems resulting from the painting, and by now Iâ€™m sure it is very pleasantly painted in various pastel shades. Our room was on the second of two floors, and was larger than most studio suites in modern hotels. It had two queen beds, a sitting area, a refrigerator, complimentary WiFi, an old style 26-32" TV that we never watched, a better than average complimentary continental breakfast, and free parking. Just donâ€™t park under the loaded coconut tree in back (see photo).... We had requested a smoke-free room due to allergies, and although the entire hotel is non-smoking, the staff put is in Room 214, which has hardwood (laminate) flooring as a precaution. The room was clean, and odor-free. The queen beds were comfortable and the room was quite large. Outside our door was a nice view of the pool area. I donâ€™t know if we will return to Key West - itâ€™s a long way to drive for a margarita - but if we do, we will stay at the BW Hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: JudyChicagoland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the quiet side of Duval Street. We enjoyed that and it was easy to get to the shops and restaurants. The hotel was clean, breakfast was good and the front desk people were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western we have ever stayed visited.”
Reviews.Author: vibe131
Reviews.Content: We had a very large room with a king bed. The staff was knowledgeable about Key West and helped us find a great place to have dinner our first night. The room was clean and quiet. Definitely will come back if in area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and good size rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Skipton_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here. Receptionist was quite helpful. Room was a good size, 2 queen beds and still enough space. Decor was a bit tired, but everything worked and the bed was very comfortable.. Room was very quiet, although the motel is the standard US pattern of external corridor past front of rooms. If there had been any noisy late night revellers this could have been a problem, but in our case it was fine. Location is just a short 5 min. walk to the quiet end of Duval street, and about a further 20 minutes up Duval to the 'Sunset Celebrations', getting louder and noisier as you go north on Duval. Decent size pool in the central courtyard. Free buffet breakfast, not fantastic but well adequate. There is a small beach just south of the Hotel on Duval, but did not try it. The first night we ate at an italian restaurant on the southern end of Duval. Think it was called La Trattoria. Nice meal, good service, would go again. 2nd night ate at Camille's just up Simonton. Had a voucher from the hotel for free Key Lime Pie. Meal here was really nice. Last night tried another Italian next door to Camilles. OK, but not up to the standard of the other 2. General comment on Key West. Bit of a culture shock after sedate Naples. Glad I went, saw the sunset etc, but a bit loud for me. Would I go again? - probably not, but then I am 60. More my scean 20 years or so ago,.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location-No Scooter or Bicycle Needed”
Reviews.Author: BlackHawks1960
Reviews.Content: Was able to check in early on a Thursday in January. Had a Great Room with two large Queen Beds. Separate Shower with Sink and and a outer Sink for your partner to get ready for the Days Activities. Breakfast Room only had 14 seats but the Outside Pool Area and Room is always a good second Choice. My Room was extremely clean and bright. Limited handicapped parking but I heard Ni C/o. The location is absolutely Great. Right next Door to a Cuban Market and Sandwich Bar and 25yards to get a ride on the Conch Train or Trolley. The Conch is better for pictures if you are restricted for time. My two nights @ this Hotel were the Best on my 3 week plus Vacation to Florida. Walking to Duvall Street and all the sights were extremely easy for Seniors and Handicapped People. Scooters, Bikes were all available but YOU do NOT need them if you enjoy walking.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nosassenach
Reviews.Content: Very nice room,exceptionally clean,breakfast was so-so. Very easy checkin and out. The staff were very helpful and gave clear concise directions to Duval Street and Mallory square which were within easy walking distance. (Note: This is the only BW that we have ever come across that takes the fees up front on booking,when not booking a web saver.)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean room, great wifi connection, nice pool and hot tub.”
Reviews.Author: SusanJH11
Reviews.Content: Good situation close to Duval Street, and within walking distance of Mallory Square and Fort Zachary Taylor. Room was spacious with 2 queen sized beds, decent bathroom and shower, desk and high sped Internet. Microwave and fridge, but no cutlery or crockery, which seems a strange omission, what are you supposed to eat with? Lovely pool and hot tub, with tables round which was nice for breakfast in the sun. The exterior was being painted while we were there, but this did not cause any problems. If the hotel is going to do any more improvements I would suggest soundproofing, as the plumbing is rather noisy , especially if your neighbours take a late night bath as ours did. Breakfast is complementary, and ok but not exceptional. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ThePerk76
Reviews.Content: Love this place! We visit Key West each year for the Parrothead convention in November and this has turned into our favorite place to stay. Nice, clean rooms, great location and the staff is wonderful. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CruisinCherie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Our room was very large and included two queen beds, refrigerator/microwave, other normal amenities. It was very clean and everything worked very well. The breakfast was nothing fancy, but adequate enough to start the day. We liked that the hotel was in a quieter part of town, but still one block from Duval Street and an easy walk to the busier parts of town. The Old Town Trolley stopped one block from the hotel, and we used that for the two days we were there to transport us around town, in addition to the 90 minute tour of the city. There is a small grocery story across the street from the hotel, and scooter/bicycle rentals right next to the grocery. This was a very convenient location without the noise and hustle/bustle of Duval Street. The pool was heated and there were plenty of lounge chairs to accomodate many guests. We would definitely stay here again. .

Reviews.Title: “OK ... room reeks of disinfectant”
Reviews.Author: Battenkill
Reviews.Content: We're in the midst of spending 2 nights here ... weather is very nice. The location is good and the people are pleasant. The tile floors are rather dirty ... my wife walked around barefoot and her feet needed major washing. There is a very heavy scent (ugh) of disinfectant in the room that does not dissipate ... something may have died in the room. We should have asked to be moved ... too lazy to migrate. Would I return? Never. This looks like a motel for the 1970's ... reasonably OK ... beds OK ... sink drains semi-clogged ... OK parking. It's a good location and needs "urban renewal" using a Caterpillar D-9 (bulldozer). We come to Key West yearly ... many of the hostelries are "beyond prime". Key West is entertaining for a couple of days ... gets old in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “The Place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Judith G
Reviews.Content: In town for the Key West Literary Seminar and stayed at the Best Western. Great location, easy access to everything happening in Key West. Scooter rental across the street, great Cuban deli down the street. Excellent staff that gave great coupons and advice. Good breakfast! Recently renovated and very up to date. Clean and huge room! What more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jletsgo
Reviews.Content: If looking for a nice, clean well maintained hotel, stay at this one. The rooms are very big. Ours had 2 queen size beds, 2 comfy chairs, big bathroom, desk and chair, free internet, towels for the pool, good maid service, very nice continental breakfast and very friendly front desk staff. The pool is heated and very big with a hot tub and plenty of pool chairs to go around. Also liked that they had tables and chair with umbrellas if you wanted to play cards or games or just eat around the pool. This hotel is one block away from south beach and at the quiet end of Duvall..this hotel sits one street over from Duvall on Simonton. This was our first time staying at this hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here next time too”
Reviews.Author: Picea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet part of Key West, but still just a few minutes walk from the action on Duval street. We asked for a quiet upstairs room and that was exactly what we got. No traffic noise and comfortable, medium hard beds, we slept really well. The room was spotless and quite large for Key West. We only had coffee from their breakfast bar, it was pretty good and they had real half-and-half, always a winner! Didn't sample any of the other offerings so I can't comment on the food. The pool area in the courtyard was well kept and had plenty of loungers. We really enjoyed catching some sunshine there. Even on a cool and blustery day the pool deck was sheltered from the wind and felt comfortable and quiet. I imagine it can get pretty hot there during summertime, though. The receptionists were friendly and very helpful, letting us keep the parking spot for the afternoon after checking out. Parking is horrible in Key West, so that was a treat! The parking was free as well. I am giving this hotel top rating as a good quality chain motel, obviously - don't expect a first class resort if you go. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: naonaok2
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located ouside of downtown, yet within walking disctance to many tourism sites i.e. Southernmost point, famous Duval street. Two queen room we had was wide enough, very clean, seemed like recently renovated. It had microwave, mini-fridge, coffee maker, hair driers. Bath had double sinks and tap/shower with good pressure. It had LCD TV on the wall too. Wifi connection was free which was OK in speed. We found front staff were changed several times a day but were always friendly and helpful when asked for anything. There was inside courtyard with a pool and a jacczie , which made us feel cool even mid-day. Free continental breakfast maybe on average, but good enough to start the day. It had some choices in hot items other than eggs. There was a grocery store/Cuvan caffe open till late night just few steps away which was very convenient. Fine Japanese restaurant (called Ambrosia) was also nearby. Rent was relatively reasonable. Overall, plus were location, basic but good enough quality of amemity/service for price. Minus were hard to find: no view (as with many motels in the town), some rooms near entrance may hear noise from laundry/housekeeping room. This can be a motel with great value especially for family with kids like us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room, very clean”
Reviews.Author: patm82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the southernmost point marker (buoy) and south beach. The quiet end of Duval street is also close, the more crowded and loud part is an easy 10min walk from the hotel. Perfect to go out and return to a quiet location to sleep. Our room was really large, we're 4 people in a 2 queen room and there was plenty of space for all of us and our luggage. There was even a second sink outside of the bath, very convenient! The room was very clean and well looked after. The pool looked nice, but we didn't use it. The price was considerable higher than in other places in Florida. It was sensible for Key West though. Included breakfast was good, the free wifi worked well but was slow. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: longy442
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last August, it was so clean and tidy, we loved it. Just a pleasant stroll from Duval and a stones throw from Southernmost Point. The pool was great and again spotlessly clean. Lovely cool rooms with comfy beds. We have booked to stay again next August.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding. Completely redone motel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: tulipberlin
Reviews.Content: When we booked the place we didn't expect anything at all. When we checked in we were absolutely thrilled by the place. It must have just been completely remodelled and everything is brand new. Add to that a perfect location with a 10 minute walk to the action of Duval Street - can't beat that! Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to have good experience at BW”
Reviews.Author: can80an
Reviews.Content: Pros / Tips - Close to airport. But apparently, all cabs charge per person? $8-$10 one way per person - Choose the tiled floor room. I imagine carpet the gets wet from people coming back from pool, beach may give off a damp smell - A lot of room amenities, refer to BW website, spacious room with the double beds - Great value for rate...but then again I used my mom for her "senior rate" age. LOL - It's close to the Southernmost point marker, but it is a bit of a walk. 25-30 min stroll - Located away from the main Duval St with the bars, so it decently quiet at night - Maintenance and maids were very friendly - I saw other posts rated the reception staff poorly but the ones I encountered were very good. As long as staff are civil and professional, I'm fine. Not like other posts complaining that they didn't smile or ask how the guest was doing. Who cares. If the staff can do their job in a decent civil manner, I consider that a win. - Complimentary breakfast was decent. Again for the rate I paid, it was good. - Didn't use the pool but it was always clean. The whole grounds and hotel was always clean Cons / Tips - Room we were in had low shower pressure, water temp wasn't constant...hot/cold hot/cold Stayed 1st week of Dec 2011. Absolutely would recommend you stay here. Or at least price check and research the BW website

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel on the 'quiet side" of Duvall”
Reviews.Author: JudyTerri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel mainly for the price and the fact that it was a few blocks from the craziness of Duvall Street. It was near the trolley stop too. We bought trolley tickets for the 2 days we were there but still walked most places because the hotel is in an great spot. The room was very spacious, had a living room area, desk, plus a mini fridge and microwave. It also had 2 sink areas so we weren't bumping into each other in the morning. They even supplied a free bag of microwave popcorn for us to enjoy. We didn't eat the continental breakfast, but seeing how many people were packed into their small dining area, it must have been OK. The bed was big and comfy and most importantly, clean! We did see a few tiny ants on one of the sinks, but in Key West, they are the norm, not a sign of dirt. Woudl recommend this hotel highly and the price was right compared to those B & B's all over town.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: duff m
Reviews.Content: good room on ground floor and beside the pool, good for the kids and access in and out, parking was tight but good. they have done some reno work in the pool area adding palms around the pool nice feature. breakfast was crowded with all guest in at the same time. close to walk to many things, and liquids to take back to the room. clean mostly and quiet for this time of year. service was good at front desk. duff m dec /11

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Travel02886
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for a wedding November, 2011, and stayed at Best Western Hibiscus. This hotel is in a great location and a fantastic value for the price, as long as you donâ€™t want to be in the middle of the bars/restaurants on Duval. It is located one block from the Butterfly Conservatory, one block from the Hop-on Hop-off Trolley, a few blocks from Southern Most Point, three blocks from the quiet end of Duval Street. We walked almost everywhere, even though we had a rental car. We even walked to Mallory Square for sunset a few times, which is at the other end of Duval Street. It was about a mile each way to the end of Duval, but flat and easy to walk. Also, there are tons of restaurants and bars to stop into on the way if you need a rest. The room was clean and much larger than we expected. The hotel was quiet, and there was always room at the pool. Continental breakfast was simple but ok. We ate there twice during our stay. Nice option to take breakfast to the outside tables near the pool. The only conâ€™s about our stay were that the shades on the windows were wooden slats. While they added a touch of Key West to the ambience of the room, they didnâ€™t close all the way and there was a light right outside our room at night that was very bright. It was ok for us, but if anyone is a light sleeper and needs total darkness, this would have been a problem. Also, something was wrong with the shower/hot water. Every 20 seconds or so it would go from hot to freezing (and I mean freezing) cold and then back to hot 20 seconds later. My husband said he moved it to hotter when it was freezing and it worked for him. I did it once and it came back scalding, so I just kept jumping out of the spray when it turned freezing and waited for it to go back to normal. Made for very quick showers LOL!! To my regret, I didnâ€™t mention it to the hotel management. I was afraid they would ask us to move, and we were already unpacked with a weeksâ€™ worth of stuff all put away. I also thought it might just be bad timing and we were just trying to shower when everyone else was. But, when we were up at 4am on our last morning to leave and it happened then, I figure it wasnâ€™t timing. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it to anyone going to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: goldilox2677
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel because of price and location over Thanksgiving. The pool is big and heated (somewhat) and there is a nice hot tub to relax in after a day of sightseeing. It's on the quiet end, which is nice if you aren't someone who loves the 'woo hooing' of Duval at 1 a.m. :) but it's a bit of a walk from Duval, so you will need a car or scooter or a bike for getting around to those places (cab rides are steep). Some cons are damp room which smelled somewhat like mildew and a very loud air conditioner. The rooms are dated and the tiles in the bathrooms should be scrubbed. Also, taking a shower was a bit of a roulette game of hot or cold. Randomly, the water would turn to freezing cold and back to scalding hot while you were trying to shower, which was unpleasant. All in all, this is a good motel for the price (we only paid about $622.00 for 5 nights which is quite reasonable for a holiday in Key West considering the nice pool). And, hey.... if you are like us, you're not in the room a lot anyway, so if these things don't bother you, then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect ..........”
Reviews.Author: sja
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 11 nights recently and I can't praise the hotel enough. Great rooms and a great pool. Staff very friendly and the breakfast was much better than expected. The location is perfect for peace and quiet without being too far away from the action. This is the quieter end of Duval but we got cycles and found it easy to get around ( and safe ) day and night. All in all a great hotel all ound.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: dicomp
Reviews.Content: Perfect location-3 blocks from South Beach, 1 block from Duval Street at quiet end. Best price around and includes adequate continental breakfast. Upgraded to amazing, beautiful spotless 2 room suite with queen beds on ground floor. Pool area/hot tub was beautiful and always clean. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Perfect place for our family of 4 adults over thankgiving weekend! Will definitely stay again! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guests Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here, this time for four nights. Very happy again. Can't think of a single complaint. Highly recommended unless you need amenities such as room service, onsite bar, onsite restaurant--otherwise you'll do no better in oldtown Key West. Endless bars and restaurants start only steps away...

Reviews.Title: “Disney For Adults”
Reviews.Author: Stephie4821
Reviews.Content: Simple and to the point. Great service, clean room, amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Southernmost
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this hotel for one night because we needed a place to stay prior to getting into our weekly timeshare. I was amazed at the room size and how nice it was considering the age of the hotel. They've done a great job renivating the room to keep the inside up to date. It was a good location for southend Duval attractions / restaurants. Also, they let us check in early, which was nice since our flight arrived before normal check in time. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL CONVENIENT TO ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: COSTA4U
Reviews.Content: The room was clean with plenty of freebies including microwave popcorn. It was quiet and the staff are very efficient. It is within walking distance of major attractions such as Ernest Hemingway house etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: jillyj69
Reviews.Content: Its on the quieter end of the touristy area of Key West, one block east of the world famous Duval Street near the southernmost point. Southernmost house is 2 blocks south with a nice little beach next to it. Staff are friendly and helpful.The rooms are large and clean and breakfast is included! Beautiful large pool and hot tub to lounge around.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller954
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average in most senses of the word. The location was a 10 minute walk from the heart of Duval street, so it is easy enough to be in the fun area. Also very close to the Southernmost point. The room had very effective air conditioning, nut apart from that was somewhat of a cookie cutter design and functional. the pool was decent, althouh nothing special. Breakfast was limited in its choice, but acceptable. The best part was the staff. They were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: nickcambridge
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, easy parking and good location. Noisy pool pump through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knaapje
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites in 2 king rooms above the lobby. Very large rooms looked even like a small appartement. Seperate living, small kind of kitchen, microwave, fridge and sink nothing to cook on. Large seperate bedroom and a lot of closets. In front on the lobby roof even a terrace. Fully recommanded.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: kathiejmie
Reviews.Content: We planned to spend only one night in Key West (and this hotel) but liked the island so much that ended up staying another night. The hotel staff were very nice to us and gave us the same discount rate for the second night which we got for the first night through Expedia. The hotel room was very clean. there was free wi-fi and breakfast. The hotel pool was undergoing renovations but we were told by the front desk lady that we could use the pool at the hotel across the street. The hotel is a couple blocks away from the beach. It's very close to the Duval street where all the major attractions are.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Duval Street for a low price”
Reviews.Author: Adamsson
Reviews.Content: Best Western Hibiscus is a nice budget-hotel close to Duval Street and The Southernmost Point. Breakfast and wireless internet is free. There is a refrigerator, a microwave and a coffeemaker in the room. Some restaurants and a CVS are nearby. Wheelchair friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Bullman
Reviews.Content: Large, clean and updated rooms. Great location (just a short walk to Duvall St.). Good breakfast with lots of choices including biscuits/gravy, hard-boiled eggs, etc. Awesome pool and hot tub. Best prices in Key West. Side note: We had a serious medical records issue to deal with which involved a lot faxing paperwork. The front office staff was extremely caring and nice. The staff's help saved our vacation. Thank you Hibiscus!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will return!”
Reviews.Author: shellgirl9
Reviews.Content: Husband & I were more than satisfied w/our stay @ the Hibiscus. First, the rate was fantastic for Key West, we paid $93 for weekday & about $139 for weekend. The rooms were HUGE, including the bathroom. Very clean, no weird odors or anything. Our room had microwave & mini fridge, plus complimentary micro. popcorn. the T.V. worked well (didn't really watch too much). We loved the location, it is at the quiet end of Duvall St., but we actually walked back from the "main area" one night-it was probably around 13(?) blocks-they are short blocks, it was a great walk, we thought very do-able. You can also walk to the southernmost point from the hotel, it's only about 3 blocks away, which was really cool. Good breakfast. Some of the staff are super-friendly, some just o.k., but all very willing to give good advice on sights, etc. Didn't try the pool (too busy running around) but there were always people in there, and it looked very clean. The property is older but they have done a great job in upkeep. After pricing lots of hotels, we are really glad we stayed at the Hibiscus. Will hopefully come back to the Keys in a few years & will DEFINITELY come back to the Hibiscus!m **on a separate note, we did go to see the sunset in Mallory Square & were disappointed.....the sun does not set directly on the water in the summer! So no "Green Flash"- bummer. Other than that, great hotel, great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Room”
Reviews.Author: sam1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location and reviews. Not only was the location great but the rooms were large with a nice pool and hot tub. Free breakfast was quite nice also. Will stay here again. Very convenient to rent bicycles and see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, close to the action in Key West”
Reviews.Author: JforJonny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with a friend, room was large and well appointed. Bathroom clean and an extra sink was appreciated. Location is ideal just one block from Duval and the action of Key West is a few minutes walk away. The Southernmost Point bollard is 2 minutes away. Staff were professional and friendly.Pool area looked good and is open late but I didn't go in. As a base for Key West you can't go far wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Menace85
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today from a two night stay with a buddy. The place is basic but very clean and friendly. The breakfast was pretty good, they had waffles, bagels, and stuff like that. The room was pretty large and clean. The location was awesome for the price. Within walking distance to all the nightlife and restaurants. And a cheap cab ride away to anywhere not in walking distance. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: RobbieW57
Reviews.Content: The hotel has really big rooms. It is one of the first hotels that my wife and I have actually liked the decoration in the bathroom. The position of the hotel is excellent, one block from the bottom of Duval street. We enjoyed the included breakfast, and the pool was a good size. You won't get much better value for money for a family room in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back next year !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Islanddreamer14701
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that we had an AWESOME stay at this motel.I just don't know where to start. Not a bad thing to say. Like I said we are going back next June for 9 days this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, large room”
Reviews.Author: m5son
Reviews.Content: while this property is located 1 block from Duvall Street, it is a bit of a hike to get into the part of Duvall where all the action is. Still, for the price i paid for the room and for as large as it was, it is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - great value”
Reviews.Author: tim197
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was within walking distance of the downtown area. Quiet location good connections to transit and bus tours. Clean and well maintained property.

Reviews.Title: “Room good, location close but not too close, problem with reservation”
Reviews.Author: DeBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and unfortunately they changed my rates from my reservation. I am still working with Best Western to get that corrected, $40 per night is a lot and seems they may be trying to pull a fast one. The room was nice, very spacious, fridge and microwave. Sink outside bath, and sink inside bath! Window in bathroom too. 2nd floor - this helps avoid bugs in florida. Pool very clean but very warm water, open till midnight! Room was good, close location but you do have to walk 3-5 blocks to get near action of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - will return”
Reviews.Author: vampgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and wished we'd stayed longer. Loved the layout of the hotel around the pool (which was really deep by the way) and it wasn't a problem to bring your own drinks to drink around the pool area. Our room was huge with a fridge and microwave and two sinks. We had a problem with the shower just after we arrived but the handyman came over within 5 minutes to fix it. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a jem!”
Reviews.Author: annaquintero
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had been on the road for 3 days. We got to Key West on Monday evening at 5:00 p.m. & hated our first accomodations. We were looking for a better place on the 2nd day & called Rita at the BW Hibiscus at 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday hoping there would be a vacancy. She said "come on over, honey. I have a room all clean & ready for you". We didn't even have to wait for the 3:00 p.m. check-in. It was a beautiful room on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. Big, comfortable room with 2 separate sink areas and plenty of space for everything. Quiet too. The grounds were very clean & well maintained. Great location. We found the staff very friendly. I would definitely stay here again & recommend it to anyone traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: beachbum7784
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times but this is by far the worst and don't plan on staying again. Room is outdated, musty, and loaded with ants in bathroom and vanity! There wasn't even food close to it. It takes room service forever. I feel that being out of the room for 6+ hours is plenty of time to get your job done. We just want to be able to get out of sun and relax in the room but can't. It's especially annoying when you see all the housekeepers talking and moving slow. The room didn't even look clean after! Next June I will take my wedding guests elsewhere to stay. I'd be embarrassed by booking this place. It used to be ok... Now it just sucks.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Western Hibiscus is a great find and we will defenitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy A
Reviews.Content: I searched many of the motel/hotels and Bed and Breakfasts' in Key West trying to find the perfect accomodations for myself and my husband. We were spending 9 days in Key West and we wanted a larger room with plenty of storage/closet/drawers, as well as a large pool. I read many reviews of all the places I had searched and The Best Western had more positive reviews than negative and people seemed very pleased during their stay. We were both very happy and pleased with our decision to stay. The rooms were very nice, clean and plenty of storage for our clothes. We requested a pool side room and our room was located right by the gate to the pool. The continental breakfast was just o.k. but it is exactly what we expected and since there is not a charge for the breakfast, it was fine with us. I would highly recommend this motel and we will be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and properly”
Reviews.Author: PSI31
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the tourist center of Key West, large clean room, but be careful not to stay on the ground floor near the pool, some rooms can be noisy and dark are located in a corridor. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom. Home no more polite, simple breakfast, free parking, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Key West value”
Reviews.Author: CaptGaryAvocapa_
Reviews.Content: This was the sixth time we stayed here,We been all over the island but found this motel fits our needs best.One block off Duval makes it convenient to walk downtown but is in a quiet area.Free breakfast saves$$$ and was great each morning,the entire motel was recently renovated from top to bottom,is clean,comfortable with Large rooms.finally the price consistently better than most other motels.one block from the beach but keep in mind Key West is not your traditional beach town,there are no waves as the island is surrounded by the reef.TIPS,skip the car rental,walk or take taxis,a fare downtown is 3 bucks pp each way.the summer months are off season for KW which means cheaper rates and less crowds.Go once and you will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise delight”
Reviews.Author: Bill5925
Reviews.Content: It's not easy to find a budget hotel in Key West. Most of those under $100 or so had less than favorable reviews so I wasn't expecting much. Instead this hotel turned out to have spacious rooms, a good breakfast and a huge, L-shaped pool that was warm and deep. This was walking distance from a swimming beach and Duval Street. In fact the Island is relatively narrow, so we walked several times to the far end to watch the sunsets. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, waffles, cereal, oatmeal and much more. A point off only because no meat.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay, even compared to 5 stars in area”
Reviews.Author: EscentialsSoyCandles
Reviews.Content: We just checked in yesterday for a 5 day stay and I loved this place so much I had to write the review this morning when I woke up! We come to key west every July for mini-season. This is our 5th family trip to KW with our kids ages 7,9,13. We have stayed at 2 high end hotels on the island: Reach Resort, Marriott Beachside and the moderate priced Sheraton Suites. All on the other side of the island and paying up to $235 per night. We always seem to get a good deal as I book at least 3 months in advance. I was a little wary of some of the reviews and the fact that I got it for $98 a night I was not sure what to expect. Key West hotels are always expensive. We arrived at 9:15 am and check in is at 3. We were greeted by a friendly lady named Rita who said we could have breakfast, use the facilities and she would call us when the room was ready. We had just eaten at Denny's on Duval but the kids wanted to use the pool. We were called at around noon to tell us the room was ready. I had requested a first floor remodeled room as myself and kids suffer from allergies. The room was huge! Much bigger than even the suite we stayed in last year at the Sheraton. The motel is cute and cozy. Parking is free, free wifi and close to everything. The breakfast has excellent selection. Definetly beats paying $45 at Denny's. The kids said they love this hotel the best....and that says alot. We will definetly make this our hotel of choice for our future Key West visits. Our little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TokyoRocker
Reviews.Content: If you can get past the fact that all accomodation in Key West is overpriced, BW Hibiscus offers great value. It is close enough to be able to explore all the highlights of KW, but far enogh away to maintain a semblance of peace. The rooms are big and clean, and the pool is fantastic. I was here for the very crowded and hot July 4 weekend and spent a lot of time in the pool. The breakfast was good but they ran out of waffles for the kids. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in KW.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for The Money”
Reviews.Author: joeswifeNj
Reviews.Content: Arrived early from our stay in Marathon and being a sunday the area was very busy went to the front desk @1pm and asked if we could check in early yes it was a woman and she could not have been nicer, we could not check in but could do our paperwork and leave the car so we could begin our vacation. Our room did not have a pool view but it was huge, The pool was the best and it was open til 12am well maintained . Breakfast was basic but what did you expect. A very clean hotel, Quiet and you could walk to everthing and if you had too much fun a cab was only $7.00 Hope to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Agree with everyone else about the woman at the desk”
Reviews.Author: twink62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 6/25 for only one night because the B&B we stay at was booked for a wedding. I have read the reviews from others about the woman at the desk. OMG! She acted as if she was doing us a favor by even speaking to us. I have plenty of friends and sure wouldn't lose sleep if she wasn't my friend. We were early and had to wait forever for her to take our luggage to lock it up. It was so much trouble for her to attend to our bags. She was not nice and she was not friendly. The next morning we went down for breakfast and I went to the pop machine to get a Diet Coke and when it came out, it was a regular Coke. I went to the counter to tell her and you would have thought I had killed her first born child. She rolled her eyes at me and then called someone to come and help me but it took him like 10 minutes to get there and I had told my husband and friends to go ahead and eat without me. It was ridiculous. She was rude to others while I was sitting there waiting. The room itself was very nice and very clean. Knowing KW like I do, I wouldn't stay there unless I had to because it is at the other end of the island and we don't like to be that far from the places we go. I also probably wouldn't stay there again because of the reception we (and apparently others) received from "Miss Key West." BW really should rethink the help that is going to "greet" the public.

Reviews.Title: “What A Find!”
Reviews.Author: QuestForFun
Reviews.Content: Do not let the reviews that complain about location stop you from staying here. I have been making trips to key west for several years now and have stayed at some of the more "upscale" hotels on the island and paying for it. I booked through hotels.com and found this jewel. Great staff and service, spacious room and a pretty good little breakfast. Most of all, it was half the price of SOUTHERNMOST (landmark hotel) and the room was just as nice, if not better. And as far as location.... yes, it is south of Truman St. (north is where all of the "tourist hangouts" are located), but the island is only a mile wide. And there are quite a few very good dining and shopping experiences that you may miss if you never come south of Truman (Sweet Tea's has some of the best food and prices). So don't let the walk discourage you and if your feet get tired, take a pedal taxi.... price negotiable, but posted as $15 for 10 minutes... up to three people and the ride from one end to the other is under 10 minutes. Or, rent a bike for the day for under $15.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but female desk staff lacks...charm :)”
Reviews.Author: lob
Reviews.Content: We (2 females 50ish on a girls getaway) stayed here 6/25-6/28. I was so pleased to find the rooms large and very very clean!! The pool was nice and the location was outstanding!! Our only disappointment came when we had to interact with the female front desk staff (there was an older gentleman who was very nice and helpful). On our first night we asked for directions to a particular restaurant. I apparently mispronounced the name (literally putting the emphasis on the wrong syllable) and the woman behind the desk acted like she had no idea what I was asking. As if the name of the restaurant was "white" and I was asking for "black". When I told her we were looking for the Cuban restaurant she shook her head, rolled her eyes and provided us with directions. We walked out of there feeling rather uneasy but shrugged it off. The next day, my friend's key would not work so she went down to the desk and asked to have it re-keyed. Since here name was not on the room, they gave her a hard time. My friend provided them with the room # and my name but they kept insisting that there was no one by my name on the room even though I had booked the room and they had my credit card! As it turned out, they did not have my name with the apostrophe. They keyed her card, offered no apology and my friend came back upstairs. This was a different female worker at the front desk. 2 females, both unfriendly...not a great impression. Having said that- location, location, location! I would stay here again but maybe I'll take my husband next time. I'm thinking those ladies wouldn't be quite so rude if a man was involved.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT GIRLS GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: tswife79
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to find it very fresh and refreshing. The colors of the rooms are so relaxing. We felt like we had our own little beach house. We never heard any noise from outside or our neighbors. The pool was very clean. It was a very great stay, Breakfast was very basic. Pastries, cereal, boiled eggs and biscuits and gravy. The shower would surge occasionally. When I googled it I thought that we would be able to walk down to the end of the street for a small beach area but when we got there, this was not the case. It is the end of the street and blocked off. Surrounding hotels groom their beaches and push their extra up to this area. However, Southern Most beach was within walking distance. It was fairly crowded. We opted to drive to Hibbs beach which was just a few blocks away. We would choose the Hibiscus again with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Queit Place in Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: newjade
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip to Key West, after much research about the area. Glad that we chose the Hibiscus. The rooms are large, clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable for motel standards. The scooter and bike rental place is only a block away, so it is very nice to be able to rent a scooter for exploring Key West. The staff was helpful and courteous. If we return to Key West this will be our motel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Oachie
Reviews.Content: Great location. Spotless rooms. Landscaping unbelievably beautiful. Pool littered with ashtrays. This place would be perfect if the kids didn't have to dodge the ash trays. I thought this place was smoke free.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracyryan
Reviews.Content: big, clean rooms and awesome pool area. very clean. very friendly staff. great location.

Reviews.Title: “our 25th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: scowencrs
Reviews.Content: we had a king size bed, hugh room, sitting area. room was really clean and cleaned up really good everyday!! and questions or help we needed was answered or helped!! nice pool!! we had a great time. walking distance from lots of resturants and things to do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choise”
Reviews.Author: LVO1975
Reviews.Content: I did some review before entering Key West. I noticed that most hotels are more expensive compared to other regions in Florida and the Best Western Hibiscus overall had the best deal for us as a family. Rooms were pretty, clean and spacious. No view from the backside were the bathroom is located. The breakfast was simple, a bit more choise in breads would have been nice. And do people only eat creamcheese on their toast at morning? The breakfast room is a bit small. Not sure if there would be seats available if >20 guests would like to have breakfast at one time. Employees at the reception were friendly (and that`s just it as I can imagine they see so many people come and go). Free parking on the hotel side is a plus. The location of the hotel is ok, main areas in KW can be reached within a 15 min walk. The beach at the end of the street is not very nice, the sand was a bit dirty because of tangle. Swimmingpool area of the hotel is nice, enough beds and umbrellas. Overall we made good choise staying in this hotel. There`s is no doubt that I would not return to this hotel, my only doubt is if a would return to KW in the near future as we found it not that special. But that`s simply because we have seen similar villages / areas with much nicer beaches in Europe/Asia/Caribean, and I can imagine the US residents like the athmosphere of KW simply because you will not find it elsewhere in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain hotel in/near old Key West”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIlLilly
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this location for several years for a week during the winter to escape the cold weather. It is a basic 2 story motel but has a very nice pool area. It is very clean and the hotel rooms are large and have best western quality bedding. The bathroom is a bit dated but that adds to the charm. A microwave, small refrig and coffeemaker are in the room for convienience. There is a nice buffet breakfast that is included with your room rate. It included the regular cold breakfast buffet, cereal and pastry choices, but also included sausage and gravy and hard boiled eggs. It was a great start to the day. The public areas were also very clean. It is about a 20-30 minute walk to Mallory Square. It's near enough to walk to everything but far enough away to be a peaceful location. The room rates are very reasonable for Key West and the best western label insures a level of quality for the budget traveller. Free parking is another perk. We've never experienced the bedbugs that a previous reviewer described. These pests come on peoples luggage and have been found even in airplane overhead bins and on public transportation. Best Western and other hotel chains have pest control procedures and policies in place at all times. This hotel is close to immaculate in housekeeping in my opinion. I don't think anyone needs to worry about insects at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, the room was large , nicely decorated and the beds comfortable. The location was quiet but not far from Duval Street and Mallory Square. The complementary breakfast was good with a reasonable choice. The staff were friendly and efficient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FresnoBob21
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Trip Advisor places to stay in Key West, selected B.W. Hibiscus hotel. This was our first visited to Key West so we needed help in selected a place to stay. Important was price and location in Key West. It turned out that the Hibiscus hotel was a perfect place to stay. The hotel price was affordable, it was in a quite area of Key West but close to Duval street and the beach, it was a very clean hotel, had a terrific pool area and there were several very nice reasonably priced restaurants within a couple blocks of the hotel. Also there was a small grocery store/deli that made terrific sanwiches a half block from the hotel and a ice cream parlor nearby. The morning continental breakfast was very good. We originally planned to stay three nights in Key West and then stop over in Key Largo for one night prior to returning to the Miami airport but because we liked the place so much we cancelled our night in Key Largo and stayed the fourth night at the Hibiscus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: sully_mn
Reviews.Content: I must echo most of the other comments regarding this hotel, it is an outstanding property and tremendous value. The rooms were large and comfortable and the pool area was very nice. This was our first trip to Key West and if (when!) we return I would definitely stay here again. One cannot beat the location and as we discovered, parking is at a premium on the island and it was nice to have a place to leave our rental car (we drove to KW after flying into Orlando). I purposely look for hotels with management responses to reviews as I take it as a sign of an engaged management team. This hotel did not disappoint and would highly recommend it for any traveling to Key West. Thank you to the Best Western Hibiscus for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: JLK9
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect staying at a Best Western, but I booked rooms for my husband and me as well as my daughter and her husband. From the map, it looked like the hotel was conveniently located, and it was. It was only a block from Duval Street, but at the southern end of Duval which is quieter than the northern end. It was easy to walk wherever we wanted to go. The rooms we got were very spacious--2 queen beds, plus two easy chairs, lots of dresser space, a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The pool was very large with a deep end at 8 ft. plus a hot tub next to the pool. The room itself was very quiet--we couldn't hear anything from any other rooms or from the outside. Breakfast was OK--cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastry, hard-boiled egg, but you're close to lots of great restaurants if you want to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected. GREAT location and fair price (for Key West)”
Reviews.Author: adventuretravelernc
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Key West are expensive. For an April weekend night, we paid over $200 for the room, which is a bargain considering it is peak season in the Keys. This property is NOT a 5 star resort, but a true 5 star resort (like the Marriott, Hyatt or Westin) will set you back hundreds of dollars a night. We certainly enjoyed this property and highly recommend it if you are looking for a clean, comfortable room for a moderate price. If you set your expectations right, this is the right property for you. What we liked: 1) FREE parking. Though there is only 1 parking spot per vehicle, free on-street parking is just around the corner 2) Location, location, location. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from the southernmost point marker and a short 10-20 minute walk from Mallory Square 3) Our room was spacious and large. We shared the room with another couple, and didn't feel cramped! 4) A very nice courtyard pool and landscaping. It was certainly a relaxing setting. The hotel is only 2 stories and there is no elevator if you are staying on the 2nd floor. Maybe the room could have been a little cleaner (some dirt behind furniture), but it was definitely acceptable and there was no evidence of bed bugs. While rates were expensive, it is about right relative to the Key West market, and we definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It....And Not a Bed Bug in Sight!”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: My review is going to be a tad long as we spent 5 nights at this hotel and I have a lot of details... First off, I have to say that when I see a complaint about bed bugs on this site, I get very wary when the reviewer has only has that 1 contribution under their belt. Secondly, I expect to see some pictures posted of the bugs or maybe actual bites or perhaps even a certified report from the CDC. We did not see any bed bugs (or any types of bugs at all, for that matter) nor get bitten by any during our 5-night stay. Ok, now that that's out of the way.... Rita at the front desk was very gracious and allowed us to change our room type upon check in. I originally thought I wanted a renovated room on the first floor (the renovated rooms have tile flooring), but we changed our minds and stayed in room #223, a second floor, corner unit. I do not believe the room has been completely remodeled but the ambiance was fine. If you need a king bed room, you need to try to pull some strings as they only have 6 I believe. Parking is onsite and free, which is a real asset in Key West. The buildings themselves are built out of concrete block and thus the rooms are very quiet. The room had two double beds, a TV armoire that had three drawers, a long bureau with six big drawers, and two big arm chairs with a small table by the AC unit. One thing worth mentioning is that the AC unit is big and nice, but it's a wall unit (not central AC). The AC was not so noisy that I couldn't sleep though, and I am a bit of a light sleeper. The bathroom setup was great. In the full bathroom there was a sink and even a grab bar in the shower/tub combo if you needed it. There was an OPENING WINDOW in the bathroom which is really unheard of in hotel rooms nowadays and just awesome when you needed to introduce some fresh air into the room. The exhaust fan worked great. Then outside of the bathroom there was a vanity area with yet another sink and a big counter to put all of your toiletries on. The real bonus for me was the small fridge and microwave. Both worked perfectly and the fridge was VERY QUIET. I was afraid it was going to be grunting all night but it was barely noticeable. Iron worked great as did the hair dryer and the coffee maker. The pool area was never so crowded that we couldn't get loungers together. The temp in the pool was always just right, probably around 84 degrees. There is also a hot tub but I didn't venture into it. A nice treat were the large pool towels that the hotel supplied, which we found on the shelf in the closet. There is no pool bar but we didn't care about that, as it kinda keeps the riff raff out. As for the location, it served us just fine. It is at the corner of United and Simonton down towards the Southernmost end of the key (the quiet end). We were far enough from the tourist traps of Mallory Square and Front Street but close enough to the fun nightlife on Duval. We rented bikes around the corner and used those for a couple of days - what a great way to see Key West. If you are coming to Key West for a night or two, you might want to stay closer to the action but we are old people trapped in young bodies and preferred the quieter, more low-key location of the Hibiscus. Service was great. We only asked for housekeeping twice and that's what we got (there is the usual card you slide into the key swipe, asking for either privacy or housekeeping). At no time did we receive service when we didn't want it nor get anyone knocking on our door when we had the privacy sign displayed. Didn't take advantage of the free breakfast that often but it was ample. Our friends stayed in a first floor remodeled room, I think #117. The remodeled rooms do look nice - very modern with dark wood furniture. On the first night, their AC was so loud that they had to complain the next morning. Well the hotel completely replaced the entire AC unit that day when they were out sightseeing! How's that for service?! We were very sad to leave this place. It had everything we needed for an extended stay. The hotel really grew on us and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was friendly, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: dld50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older hotel, cinderblock walls that help with noise control, rooms are a nice size, which have been updated nicely, beds comfortable. TV's are not HD, but who is watching TV while in Key West? Staff are friendly. Complimentary breakfast was adequate. We would come back again. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not the best quality.”
Reviews.Author: jonhowe
Reviews.Content: Checked in smoothly and dropped our stuff off in the room. Went out for dinner. When we came back we noticed a number of issues with the room. The toilet seat was not connected to the toilet, the room smelled a bit like cigars, and there were small stains on the sheets. Very mediocre overall, we ended up driving back to our place on Big Pine to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the BW Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: BackwoodsMN
Reviews.Content: No complaints here! Really enjoyed the extra large room, pool, breakfast and location. We rented bikes and also walked - very convienent location. Prices in Key West are high for hotels so I feel like we did OK. Staff was freindly and helpful. No sign of bugs as stated in previous post - believe me I checked every hotel we stayed at not only in Key West but other locations in Florida. Being from northern MN we enjoyed our tropical stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Alert !”
Reviews.Author: mjfmail
Reviews.Content: So I read the reviews and thought we were going to really enjoy our stay. And it started out that way, until I was waiting for my husband the second day we were in Key West. On the internet planning our day, a bed bug walked across the pillow. The head boards are infested...... please check your room thoroughly! Iit's true that you get what you pay for in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “seeing is beleiving”
Reviews.Author: troy97
Reviews.Content: this must be my favouirte best western i have ever stayed at. incredible location. really close to everything in key west. beautiful pool and pool area. lovely room. try to get a pool facing upper room. only downside is that the breakfast area is too small. just 3 tables. other than that an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, a little shabby round the edges and expensive”
Reviews.Author: AndyJoManchester
Reviews.Content: Location is great, 2 streets back from the main strip so nice a quite but not far from things. Pool lovely, very warm and lots of seats. Breakfast very basic, help yourself from a selection of breads, pastries and yogurts. The room was big, 2 double beds and a sitting area but the carpet was a little warn out and it felt like it was ready for a refit. That said it was very clean. The biggest thing that lets it down is price. Due to the location and Key West being so popular you get alot less value for money. We stayed at Coral Lagoon in Marathon in a 2 bed town house for the same price as this room.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience if you are not a student”
Reviews.Author: travelller1
Reviews.Content: Not only were the rooms "musty", but the march break students (runs all month) were given free reign. No security to patrol to keep the noise level down..especially at 4:30 am when the bars close and the students return to the hotel. As they had taken over the pool area, there was no where, where others could sit out on the hotel property and enjoy the weather. Staff response:' the students should be able to have fun too!" (of course..but at these rates, others should be considered as well.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: meryp89
Reviews.Content: older hotel-great location. very clean. spacious rooms. one block over from duvall street,but about ten blocks from the action. not a bad walk and very safe. while in key west, it is best to stay near duval st. if you drink - therefore you can walk back to your hotel. there are two best westerns- one near duval and the other near the airport. if you stay near the airport, you will be paying for taxis, as everywhere there is a charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: booler
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Key West. The Best Western is located right next to the Southernmost Hotel (which we stayed at last time) but was priced over $100 cheaper per night. I have to say I was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms included a fridge and a microwave and for the most part were quiet (there were some Harley owners staying near us so needless to say we knew when they were coming and going but such is the great American bike). The continental breakfast was no frills (bagels, oatmeal, cereal, toast and biscuits and gravy) but always full. There is a pool and a small hot tub if you want to just hang out and relax. There is no bar on the property. The hotel is only one block from the south side of Duval Street (Duval and United) and really close to an great restaurant for breakfast (Banana Cafe) on Duval. There is ample parking if you have a rental car and a scooter rental only a block away. There is also a MAC machine at a bank right across the road. It is about a 3/4 mile walk to Mallory square from this hotel but you pass a lot of great bars and stores on Duval St., and some really nice houses and hidden restaurants on Whitehead St. (one block past Duval) and Simonton St. (which boarders the hotel) on your way there. Definitely worth checking our via foot or scooter.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - but really nice”
Reviews.Author: mailstop
Reviews.Content: Large, super clean room. Good location for walking to Duval St. shopping and catching the trolley at station #11. Not much to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rmc76
Reviews.Content: Very spacious, clean, quiet, comfortable room. For me, the location was perfect - a block off Duvall within walking distance of good restaurants and a couple blocks from the water/beach. Although this is definitely at the quieter end, we easily walked the length of Duvall from this location. The pool area looked ok and the breakfast was a little less than what we have gotten used to at other mid-range chains, but neither is a deal-breaker for us . As nice as this place was, I thought it was over-priced for what you got, but probably not for Key West

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: srrmsu
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hibiscus is an excellent choice for a hotel in Key West. It is centrally located, is very clean, the rooms are huge and the staff is great. They have a nice pool and hot tub area. I don't know what more you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay at BW in KW”
Reviews.Author: LisaC40
Reviews.Content: After trying to balance all factors for a 4 day stay in KW (price, parking, location, amenities), I picked the BW (in large part due to its good TA ratings) and was very happy. The room was very large - had 2 queen beds, 2 chairs, and plenty of room to move around. The breakfast was substantial. Made great use of the hot tub and enjoyed the location - easy to walk to the Southern Point or Duval Street or drive down Simonton to the parking near the waterfront and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: namma
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this Best Western and were very pleased. The location is superb and we never moved our car . Walking distance to everything, just one block off Duval, near the southern most point of USA , nice pool, large rooms, good breakfast, free internet use. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great pool, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jcg410
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, 2 queen beds, sitting area (2 chairs and table) desk, wifi included, free breakfast (limited choices), parking on-site, nice pool (always could get lounge chairs). Front desk staff very helpful. Not very close to Mallory Square or stores on Duval Street, but we found parking to be easy enough (meters) and very easy to find our way round town.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and a large room”
Reviews.Author: korybak
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel/motel. The room was very large, clean and updated with good beds and pillows. It is 1 block off Duvall St but a 15 - 20 minute walk to Mallory Square. But, it was a nice, interesting walk when we chose to not take the trolley. Good restaurants and bars all along Duvall kept the stroll fun. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL-NO NEED TO LOOK ANY FURTHER”
Reviews.Author: Patti0925
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from nov 13 - 20th 2010. This was our 3rd stay here and we love it. We actually just booked our trip for this nov 2011. We do not even want to stay anywhere else.. It is very convient to everything.Its just one block from the quiet end of duval street and a couple of more blocks and you are right in the middle of all the excitement. not to much further and you are at mallory square for sunset. you can eat, drink and shop your way around town.. It is close to other attractions as well, the southernmost point, key west butterfly conservatory, etc.... The rooms are very clean,roomy, and reasonably priced. Staff is pleasant and very helpful. We traveled with our friends who have stayed here even more times than my husband and i. I highly recommend the best western hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL LOOK HARD & LONG TO FIND A BETTER SHORT TERM STAY”
Reviews.Author: rnblue
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old Florida charm. The baths are somewhat dated, but very clean. Location is perfect ... easy to all the Old Town attractions and who would really want to go to New Town! Tip, ask the hotel about the Old Town Trolley that stops just around the corner ... be sure to get the one that lets you get on and off at any of 12 stops. The price of the ticket is also good for two days. Hotel has a wonderful staff, great location, many good restaurant close, great pool for relaxing, and a safe & quiet location. Only negatives is a weak breakfast, but as good as other similar hotels offer and somewhat dated bathrooms. Enjoy it, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay and Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: MN_Traveler38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Best Western Jan 14-18, 2011 and found the reviews we read prior to our trip were accurate. Our room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. The flooring was a wood laminate rather than carpet which adds to the clean feel--I am always grossed out thinking how many feet have touched the carpet in hotel rooms! The hotel is a comfortable 15 minute walk to the action on Duvall Street and same distance to beaches. We started each day with their continental breakfast and then we were out and about until mid-afternoon. We'd get back and lay by the pool until it was time to get ready for the evening-- the pool area is nice and very underused (no fear of not getting a lounge chair). If you are new to Key West and not sure where to stay I'd say this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “It's a really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: surf6515
Reviews.Content: Staff is great with loads of information about the area; room is very clean, spacious; there is a spa and swimming pool; free parking and a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel on Key West in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: I admit I am not a big fan of Best Westerns, because some are good and some are just awful. When we booked a trip to Key West right after Christmas and I looked around this hotel had the highest ratings on Tripadvisor that I could find (because everything else was booked already). We actually liked it! The rooms are nicely decorated and our room overlooked the pool. We didn't hear any noise at all. The hotel is in a good location and we just walked everywhere and didn't need to drive. The breakfast is decent and the hotel staff was nice and professional. I thought it was a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,clean, spacious rooms & relaxing pool area!”
Reviews.Author: dancequeen33
Reviews.Content: Have been to Key West about a dozen times and have stayed in several hotels & B& B"s, some great, some not. For the price, a little over $100 per night in December, this was a very good value. Contintental breakfast was included. The location, one block from Duval, at the "quiet" end was great, because we like to walk. The beds were comfortable and my husband loved the pillows! In fact he's going on their website to see if he can purchase some. We had plenty of fresh towels in our room. which was large, clean with 2 queen beds an extra sink, TV etc. We felt very much at home. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive option in Key West”
Reviews.Author: smartcooki
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel over Christmas Dec 22-25. For around $120 per night including a great breakfast, we thought the room was a great deal. The room itself was huge, new and clean. We had two queen beds for the two of us. There was also a microwave and fridge. The shower was great and warm. Everything was cleaned daily. Our room was also on the end and very quiet, so we got great sleep. We didn't get to use the pool, but it looked very nice as well. The only potential downside of this place is the location. It's definitely within walking distance of all the action on Duval Street, but be prepared for about a 15 minute walk. It's not bad at all, but just be aware that the hotel is not in the middle of all the action, but a reasonable walk away. If you have a car, there is parking. Would highly recommend Banana Cafe a block away on Duval St for great meals (French restaurant). Also, CVS a few blocks away has inexpensive wine, drinks, and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greatgetaway
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and as before just as clean and nice. Breakfast good and plentiful, the usual continental. Very good location to Duval street. The only problem we had this time was two nights out of our three nights stay we had people partying on the patio in the pool area till well after midnight. Our room was directly opposite the main patio area only feet away. Needless to say we didn't get much sleep. The pool area should be closed at a reasonable hour to stop this happening.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, nice hot pool”
Reviews.Author: liskers
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place, easy to walk or bike to anything, the pool was very warm and the rooms were really big, rooms were very clean and looked really nice

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay in a Reasonable Location.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPensioner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. Nice touch: 2 free bottles of water on arrival. Plenty of parking space. Handy to Duval Street and 1 mile from Front Street. Trolley bus stop just 200 yards away. Good choice of continental breakfast. Good size pool. Banks nearby. Duffy's restaurant just a quarter of a mile away - good steaks. Unfortunately our room was situated on the first floor but in a covered walkway which meant that we had no natural light and therefore had to use use the room lights all the time we were there. Rooms were particularly large. We thought the room charges were expensive (our stay being over a weekend) but in comparison with other hotel charges - reasonable. Overall we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the Best Western Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: mainer5
Reviews.Content: Stayed in remodeled Rm 259, which looked great. I sprang out of bed each morning to get the complimentary breakfast and the use of the computer to send emails. I used my AAA card and got a discount, on the already low priced room. If you have a chance get a Cuban Sandwich from Anna's Cafe (part of Southernmost Grocery) across the street from the Hibiscus, towards Southernmost Point. It cost approximately $6 and was one of the best sandwiches I have had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Midrange Traveller? Look No Further in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights at this place. Wish we were still there. A huge, immaculately clean room right in innertown Key West with free parking, a passable breakfast thrown in, and an especially friendly, helpful staff--under a hundred bucks a night--what's to complain?? But some Tripadvisors just love to complain...now here's this chap that whines about the type of TV in his room...what kind of pathetic individual goes to Key West and sits around watching TV? The only TV you need to watch in Key West is at the very beginning of the day--the Weather Channel-- might help you schedule your time-- then get out and enjoy this fabulous old town. This same sad sack wants "an outdoor bar by the pool" so he doesn't have to go for a drink to the "hotel across the street". Ya sure: if he's talking about the Southernmos-t Hotel complex, he's talking two or three times the Best Western rate. Jeez, bring your own bottle(s) and be thankful that you have two clean, functioning ice machines on the property, with several poolside tables just waiting for you to enjoy your drinks out under the swaying palms. Now here's this other person who found ants in the room. In the era of the bedbug menace, ants seem harmless enough, and there's certainly no need to worry about bedbugs at this sparklingly clean spot. Wife and I did notice, just in one tiny area of the room, some very tiny ants a couple of times.Probably depends on the location of your room. The only other area of the property where we noticed these tiny critters was around a large pillar quite near our particular room, so we were probably blocking their accustomed pathways. You come to Key West partly because you will be in a lush subtropical area. We've stayed at far plusher hotels down in the Caribbean and had the occasional visit from giant flying cockroaches. These harmless critters all go with the territory...you just coexist. Now one thing mentioned by a previous Tripadvisor that we did notice is that while we loved the adjustable louvres on the windows, they do let in rather too much light at night. Light sleepers might find this a problem, though they would otherwise appreciate the overall quietness of the property and the good mattresses. Pool area was beautiful and the deck surround seemed adequate for the number of guests, there were always deck lounges free. While the breakfast area was cramped, you do have the delightful al fresco option of talking your food outside to one of the poolside tables.
