Breakfast included a couple of hot items and was kept stocked right up to closing time of 10:00am. We have been staying for several years at the nearby El Patio Motel, a few blocks further southeast from the BW Hibiscus. In fact, we stayed at El Patio earlier this year and were happy. We decided to give the BW Hibiscus a try because on this latest visit, we were offered a much better rate, especially with the breakfast included. El Patio has more charm, more of a distinctive Key West atmosphere, but in terms of creature comforts and amenities, BW Hibiscus certainly takes the prize.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but nothing great.”
Reviews.Author: SciProfessor
Reviews.Content: As of this writing in Nov. 2010, this hotel appeared newly remodeled. It was neat and clean but nothing remarkable. When they remodeled the rooms they put old 27 inch tube televisions in the rooms instead of flat screens. Who does that anymore? The pool area was very nice. The location is at the far end of Duval St. far away from the action of old town and Mallory square. This could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on your lifestyle. The continental breakfast was minimal. There are lots or nice places to eat breakfast nearby. Try one of them instead of the continental breakfast. One thing this place really needs is an outdoor bar near the pool. I had to walk to the hotel across the street for a drink. Maybe I'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night ...”
Reviews.Author: valynadine
Reviews.Content: It was a real challenge to find a good value in pricey Key West : This Hotel was one possibility, but there are others that seem to be better . The whole Hotel needs a complete renovation including the stinky airco ! As some people already wrote, we also had ants in the room. As i already mentioned : Okay for one single night ...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice for a motel a bit pricy but well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: Starviagera
Reviews.Content: This is a well maintained comfortable refurbished old style motel. The location is very central and you can walk to the Conch train station in about 20 minutes. If you feel comfortable with a bicycle it would be the best way to move around. The room had two comfortable queen beds, 2 sinks, hair dryer and coffee maker. There is free internet in the room and 2 computers in the front office. A refrigerator, a microwave and a good size TV. The towels were thin but very clean. The water sometimes would go from hot to cold. Also they should put a drape on the window as the shutters let too much ligh in. They left us popcorn two of the nights. On the third day for some reason the room was not done very well. There is a pool, it look good but we did not have the time to use. The continental breakfast was satisfactory. The night office person was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: jennaamore
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Duval St. and the southernmost point; big, clean pool; room is much larger than I expected. I thought it was a great stay for the price, since so many hotels on the island are really pricey. The breakfast was just ok, but there are lots of good places to go eat so it wasn't really a big deal. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal, great place, would come back!”
Reviews.Author: lunachick73
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in walking distance to most attractions. Pool area clean. Decent breakfast included(assorted breads cereals,hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy). Would absolutely come back!

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: genoac
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus for 3 nights. The property is located near the southernmost point and not far from Duval Street. We could walk to Mallory Square (which we did a few times) but it was a long walk. Luckily we wore comfortable sandals. We were expecting an average hotel room, but for the money we paid I felt that the room was above average. It was larger than expected and very clean. The decor was a bit sparse, but that's ok as long as everything is clean. The pool area was immaculate and there were always staff cleaning and maintaining the property. The beds were pretty comfortable--not too hard and not too soft but the air conditioner was a little on the loud side--it made a kind of knocking sound. Oddly enough (becuase I'm an insomniac) it didn't bother me. We definitely got our money's worth and I would stay there again. Parking was free too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bago1956
Reviews.Content: I have visited Key West many times and this is the best hotel I've stayed at for the price. The room was large, very clean, quiet, and well staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel. Beakfast has to be improved”
Reviews.Author: TiPi35
Reviews.Content: Good location. People are friendly. Nice room. Quiet Hotel. Breakfast has to be improved. Too bad, Key west does not have nice beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevl22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two daughters for 2 nights. Hotel staff were very polite, rooms were a good size. Parking was free. Hotel was a good walk to the busiest part of duvel street but not a real problem. Breakfast was basic but good. Only complaint was that the air con was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: cpo-chick
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Key West with my sister for a girls getaway. This hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and large and the staff very accommodating. The location was great about a mile to walk to everything but that is fine - if you have somebody who can't walk much you may want to stay closer to town - but then the rats go up. Breakfast was good for what it was. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub area even though the weather was only nice one day out of our 3-day stay. Free parking a plus. Would definitely stay again if visiting the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: gtg057s
Reviews.Content: This motel was perfect. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean. The location was right at the Southern Most point of the United States and on the South end of Duval Street. This allowed us to easily walk to areas of interest but return to our quite hotel when we wanted rest. The free parking is also a great perk. The price and location were perfect. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to the keys.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for price”
Reviews.Author: miamiman1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed priced right for summer , great location nice pool. bed were comfortable. The free breakfast was the only issue , bananas and apples looked like been through a war. and biscuts were as hard as hockey pucks. but great location..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: artieanderson
Reviews.Content: When we travel we try to find good deals because we don't stay in the room much. We selected this hotel because of comments and ratings on tripadvisor and other websites. We were not disappointed and the rooms were big and beautiful. The staff is great and the place is super clean. Good breakfast. A mile walk across the island but we didn't mind that at all. If you're going to rent scooters there is a place a block away or they will deliver. They don't have laundry but they said we could do it across the street and those folks were welcoming and helpful. Our best vacation ever and this hotel was a big reason for it. Great place to stay..rated as well as many hotels that are more expensive. We will be back. Thanks for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “"Great place to stay."”
Reviews.Author: PeterVeileborg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pool was lovely and well situated in the centre of the motel. The breakfast was very good especially as it was complimentary. The staff were particularly helpful. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: R0cc01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced, clean and comfortable. Parking on premises with nice clean pool area. Conveniently located within walking distance of good restaurants, Butterfly attraction, Southernmost point. Very pleased with our choice as we had not stayed in Key West ever! Had contemplated choosing a B&B or a newer, pricier hotel or even staying outside of Key West. Ultimately, we made the best choice for us by staying at the Best Western Hibiscus. Interior and exterior is dated and they do not offer king beds only 2 doubles. If you are looking for new and modern this place may not satisfy you. We spent time in the pool during the day and evenings and met lovely people from all over. We especially like that the pool was so well kept. Not many shaded areas but a few umbrellas. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. We did not really try the continental breakfast that was included as there are many good restaurants nearby to try if you are a breakfast lover! Coffee was good though! Did not notice many babies or young kids here - we liked that - quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny (And Didn't Cost A Lot of Pennies)”
Reviews.Author: VacationFamilyNJ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Key West at least 10 times so we know the island pretty well. Because we travel often and have a child, we look for the best deal and nice/clean accomodations. We have stayed at Inns, B&Bs and various hotels on the island. At $116 a night, this was one of the best. Great location for a family, very clean spacious rooms and nice large clean bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable. This hotel is right off Duval and walking distance to all of the action, although it's a bit of a walk. The hotel has plenty of free parking and a large clean pool. The hotel staff were very friendly and even let us check in at 10:00AM on July 5th after being full the night before. Breakfast was included although we didn't make it any of the days. We went to Pepe's every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Honest staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: shirleyrn2
Reviews.Content: At first, I was not sure about this place but am glad I did stay here. I came to Key West for a wedding at Casa Marina Resort and there was plenty of us family who stayed at different areas. This place is cozy, comfortable, had big rooms, the complimentary breakfast was excellent. The price I paid for my stay here is well worth it and plus more. The staff were honest; my son left his cell phone in the room when we left and they mailed it back to us. With gratitude, I sent them back a gift. I definitely recommend this place and if ever I have to come back to Key West, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic with a small but .....”
Reviews.Author: Late-Starter-7
Reviews.Content: The motel was great. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pool was lovely and well situated in the centre of the motel. The breakfast was very good especially as it was complimentary. The staff were particularly helpful. The only "but" was the fact that the motel was situated a 15-20 minute walk away from the main part of Duval Street. We didn't mind this too much but in the June heat, for some, it may not be an option. On the plus side, being away from the main part meant the hotel was a nice quiet retreat. Great motel, we will definitely use this place again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: indyfan58
Reviews.Content: After finding this hotel on TripAdvisor, we took a chance and we not disappointed. This is a very clean hotel with efficient check in, a very clean pool and a good location. Not far from the southernmost point buoy that everyone is photographed in. We visited the Southernmost Beach and the restaurant there is very good too. The beds are clean and comfy, the air conditioner worked great and were treated to an extra large room on the 1st floor because of our length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: Keysey22
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary of staying in a Best Western, because so many of them are dives. I was pleasantly surpised to find the hotel was rather nice. It's nothing fancy, but for travelers who would like to spend the extra money out on the town instead of a pricey room, it's just fine. It has a tropical courtyard and the pool was inviting and clean. Our room was basic and the bed wasn't the most comfy, but what you get what you pay for. Most importantly, the room was clean. No bugs that I could find (and believe me I do a thorough search including stripping the beds and inspecting). The continental breakfast was decent. It's at the quiet end of town, about a block off Duval. It was a bit of a walk to get to Mallory Square, etc. but it wasn't bad. If you enjoy walking like I do, it won't bother you a bit. Best of all- free parking. That's a rarity on the island. The only con was the shower kept switching from hot to cold. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value good for families”
Reviews.Author: wholeysmoke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the quiet end of Duval Street which is nice as you can still walk most places but is not so noisy. The rooms are very large and would be great for a family that has to put a pack n play for a baby in the room or for 4 people sharing one room. There is a separate sink and mirror outside of the bathroom so more then one person can get ready at once. Good sushi place in the hotel down the street. Great value. Breakfast just okay-mostly all carbs so not so filling. Ask for a room away from the parking lot in the back as the lights made the room too bright at night. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy in the Keys!!!”
Reviews.Author: harleychick60
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this Caribbean style hotel! Tiled floors and spacious room with 2 queen size beds. Everything was very clean and bright. Convenient to Duval street and Higgs beach. Good recommendations from staff for places to eat. I highly recommend this hotel for a relaxing visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for location”
Reviews.Author: Dutchgirl57
Reviews.Content: Great location without breaking the bank...Cllean large rooms. Good breakfast...free internet. This motel is right next to the Southernmost Hotel, and much less expensive. Nice clean pool.. Bike rental a block away. Can easily walk to the beach and Malory square. Also get Best Western points.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with Free Parking!”
Reviews.Author: LLtripisfun
Reviews.Content: We ended up on the 2nd floor on the corner. The room was large and clean. Has general bathroom and extra sink across from the bathroom which was great for me. Did also have small frig and microwave. The pool was open late which was great. Very close to the Butterfly house a must see and the Southern most point in the US. Close to Duval St but not to close for us who want to sleep in peace. The only down thing was the continental breakfast was so so not great but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: veracraig
Reviews.Content: This motel gives you a lot of value for your money. I liked the location because it is a couple of blocks from Duval street, Southernmost point, Hemingway house, Butterfly Conservatory, St. Mary Star of the Sea, Lighthouse museum, and El Siboney. Parking is free. The rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. The only negative was a rude young lady at the front desk. The other employees were nice especially the gentleman that checked us in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean & great location.”
Reviews.Author: Roryblane
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. Good location for the beach, cafe & bar around the corner. A bike rental,CVS and restaurants close by. One mile from the wharf etc. Easy walking or biking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: coulcav
Reviews.Content: We were 4 couples staying for a 4 day weekend the week before Fantasy Fest, which is considered off season. Our rate for Fri. & Sat. night was $109 & Sun. night was $89. We requested the 4 rooms over the office which all have access to a big deck over the office. The deck had tables & chairs to sit on. It was perfect for us since we all were travelling together so we weren't bothering anyone in the neighboring rooms when we sat out there. All of these rooms had a living room w/sofa, chair, kitchen table & chairs, TV & entertainment center. There was a sm. kitchenette w/fridge, cof. maker & sink. The bathroom was a good size & there was an add'l sink outside the bathroom door so someone could be in the bathroom & someone else had access to a sink & vanity. The bedroom had an extremely comfortable King size bed & a TV in the room. This bed & linens were more comfortable than the bed in the Marriott @ Marco Island (which was our next stop) & the room price of the Marriott was much higher. The pool was great as well as the hot tub. Plenty of chairs & tables. Continental breakfast was sufficient. Although I'm happy w/a cup of coffee, a muffin or a piece of fruit.

Reviews.Title: “has it all”
Reviews.Author: rustydog1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location,and rates much better than most Key West hotels. The room was very roomy &clean. You can walk to beaches, bars, and shopping. free breakfast was a bonus. I also appreciated that the manager acknowledged my response to the hotel survey Best Western sent to me. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: exBronxite
Reviews.Content: This hotel maximizes the price / value / service / convenience quotient. OK, it's not a plush Hyatt, but the cleanliness and service is on par...and at half the price. My experience with the staff from the front desk to housekeeping was grade A. (and thanks for making our brief anniversary getaway so special) We will be back, and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RMH_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Key West for the firs time and stayed at the Hibiscus in part because of reviews on Tripadvisors and we were not disappointed. The motel impressed as an older place but modernized. The rooms were very large and so was the pool with a nice warm jacuzzi (outdoors). The continental breakfast selection was a little lacking (toast, bisquits, cereal, begels, juices, etc.). The motel is located a block from Duval Street. near the south end of the island within walking distance of many of the attractions of Key West. This was very important as parking is very limited and expensive in Key West. The cost of our stay was very expensive compared to most motels but very reasonable for Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BeachMama_10
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family vacation in Key West. We were happy with the Best Western. The location is good if you are visiting with children because its on the "quiet" side of Duval, but you are still near everything. The pool was nice and the rooms were a little bigger than we expected. And you can't beat the free breakfast! The only thing that I didn't like was the lighting in the room. We were in a corridor so it was always dark in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Desk Clerk”
Reviews.Author: Trilliumhomes
Reviews.Content: After my husband, with stage four colon cancer, drove 1300 miles to Key West. He was checking into the hotel when told by Jon, a grumpy old man at he front desk, that his deposit was being refunded and his two week reservation was being cancelled. Jon continued to rant in front of everyone in the lobby saying the hotel did not need people like him staying there. This all because my husband had my credit card, however I had offered to fax my authorization immediately but was flatly refused. The thing that set Jon off was my statement to him that my husband had used the same card in April when we stayed there he continued to tell me I was lying. The whole thing seemed so surreal as I could not believe someone treating a customer that way. So My husband left to try and find a room for the night, I called Debra the general manager of the hotel twice, I left two messages . No return call. Called Best Western Corporate filed a complaint and I was told the hotel had seven days to respond to my complaint .I still have heard nothing. When I read reviews of the hotel I found at least six or more comments about the rude front desk staff mainly Jon. I think the rest of the staff is afraid to acknowledge Jon's rude treatment of customers. I am not only shocked at hotel staff being allowed to treat customers that way but of Best Western not responding to a complaint of such poor behavior of the staff. We will be back to Key West but never this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jobager
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a couple of friends for sightseeing and party around Fantasy Fest / Halloween. + Very clean and spacy room. + Nice pool area and jacuzzi. +- Breakfast could vary a little bit more (especially for us european people itÂ´s uncommon but hey, weÂ´re in the US). + Nice plus was to take the breakfast out to the pool area. + Internet worked really good. + Quiet location but never felt unsave. + Next to a little (was it 24h, I think so?) store. + Close to the southernmost hotel / point, only a couple of meters to Duval. + Sightseeing Train hop on / hop off and ticket vendor right around the corner + Bikes to rent from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: valpoconnection
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bargain! Clean and on the west side of the island by the southern most point. Spring Breakers galore, but we didn't care. We were all having fun! Nice free breakfast in the morning, and great use of free computers. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty place, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: TJDuck
Reviews.Content: On the outside of Duval and all it's craziness, but near enough to get there and enjoy it. Rooms are spacious, very clean and well maintained. Pool is large with nice jacuzzi. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Turned "40" in Key West”
Reviews.Author: salttherim
Reviews.Content: Key West is a place I have always wanted to visit. When the reality of my 40th birthday arrived I decided to do it in the Keys. The hotel was in a very good general location. We could walk just about anywhere we wanted to go. We had a suite that was very spacious, clean and comfortable. We were fortunate enought to see the Super Boats that were there that week and the Veteran's Parade was also very nice. We will travel here again and will stay at this hotel again. It had everything we were looking for. Nice people, price was right and good general location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, dirty floor”
Reviews.Author: larsenn
Reviews.Content: This is a nice smaller hotel within walking distance of the beach and Duval Street. Our room was very spacious with two queen beds and two sinks. The room looked newly remodeled and everything worked. The tile floors, however, were dirty and we had to wash our feet before getting into bed. In spite of this, our stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, great price”
Reviews.Author: lakechamplainsailor
Reviews.Content: We wanted to do Key West on the cheap and we did it by staying here. This hotel is quite a walk from all the action on Duval but if you like to walk like we do it is okay. It would take us 1/2 hour to walk to Mallory Sq for sunset. A pedicab cost us $30.00 with tip. Cab ride was only $10.00. Our room was one of the musty rooms. Right off the pool area, no light, we aired it out and turned up the AC to dry out the room and that eventually worked for us. Hey, it ain't the Ritz but it was clean, roomy, fridge for the cocktails, cheap, and breakfast was included (but we ate elsewhere) and we enjoyed all the walking. Staff was very friendly to us. I would stay here again but I would request an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: First the good points: the rooms are very large and well decorated, the beds are comfortable, breakfast is included as with all Best Westerns, and the property is well maintained. The not so good: the rooms are very dark as the only window faces into the central courtyard. Also, because people are walking past right outside the window, you might want to keep the blinds closed for privacy. Some of the ground floor rooms were under a walkway so got zero light - we were better off than that but not by much. As has been noted elsewhere, there is very limited seating in the breakfast area although we were lucky enough to get the only table outside the door - you can also use the tables around the pool. The worst point is the location which is approx 1 mile from Front Street and Mallory Square. Driving isn't really an option because the traffic is pretty choked and parking is a rip-off, so we had to walk a LOT. Not much fun in the pouring rain. There were bikes for rent at the hotel, would probably have been a good option with hindsight. Re service, very mixed. At check-in the reception was so off-hand as to be positively unfriendly. However, when I managed to drop an earring back down one of the basins, the maintenance man was quick to respond, unscrewed the u-bend, retrieved the earring back, cleaned up the resulting mess and refused to take a tip. Overall, I would only not recommend this hotel because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: beachbum7784
Reviews.Content: It is located very close to all the main attractions. We walked everywhere and was only a street away from Duval and the beaches were right down the road. The room was very clean, but we also had a more updated room. I hear some of them are a little out of date/musty. It is a very cute place and the breakfast in the morning was always great and good variety. If you go in the summer, it is so much more cheaper than their on season in the winter. The front desk staff could have been a bit friendlier but other than that, it was worth staying there and will be there again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Florida Keys”
Reviews.Author: newzealandtrip
Reviews.Content: Considering it is "high" season, good rates. Walked to town. Good Italian restaurant just about a half block away. Try the second floor, less foot traffic. Walked to Hemingway's house-good tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very clean, nice staff, convenient to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: happycouple22025
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Best Western. Lots of room, very clean, free breakfast, pool and hot tub available. Staff friendly and helpful. Close enough to Duval St., but not too close to be near the noise....very close to a bike rental place which is a great way to get around in Key West. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevnshe
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in early February. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, our room was large and very clean, and the pool area was very nice. The continental breakfast was adequate, though the breakfast area is a bit on the small side and was crowded each morning. We recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An okay stay”
Reviews.Author: marilynm4310
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel - January 17th and 18th. The hotel has all outside entrances and no elevator. We arrived in the morning and stopped to see when we would be able to check in. The desk clerk, Lein, was less than friendly and informed us he would have rooms available by 1 p.m. Despite making this reservation 4 months prior to our arrival and asking for a room on the first floor, our room was on the 2nd floor. Since there is no elevator, I had to drag my wheeled suitcase up the stairs. We had a room with 2 queen beds - it was a good size room and was clean. The room had a microwave and refrigerator along with a table and chairs. There was a sink and counter outside the bathroom along with one in the bathroom. This was a nice plus. There was a group ( 6-8) young men and women 3 doors down from us who were in a "party" mode. They were fairly noisey for a while, then left and returned late at night. I wear ear plugs when I sleep and my husband has a hearing aid - but if I didn't have the ear plugs in the noise would have been unbearable. The motel had a continenetal breakfast that I do not recommend - hard boiled eggs, cold sausage gravy and biscuits, cereal and fruit. There is a nice size swimming pool and whirlpool in the inner courtyard with plenty of lounge chairs. The motel is 1 block from Duval St. and about 3 blocks from the southernmost point. If you plan to go to Mallory Square, you are in for about 14 block walk. To me the $179 a night over priced but I know things are more expensive in Key West. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convienient location!”
Reviews.Author: Comicguide1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Hibiscus for three nights in a large room with a comfortable bed, a sitting area, and kitchenette. The room was clean, quiet, and had a second floor patio outside the room. The pool area was well-maintained, plenty of seating, and had an ice machine right near the pool gate. There were several bike rental places near the hotel and there was a small beach two blocks away. The breakfast was sufficient, and coffee was available throughout the day. When you start comparing the price of all the places you can stay in Key West, think of this place when you are making your decision. The only recommendation I would make is that they upgrade their TVs. Small tube sets with poor reception--blurry images. I did inform the main desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice motel as advertised in trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: jsambo1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nice nights at the best western hibiscus in very cold weather. The room was clean and luckily, warm, with a modern thermostat controlled heater. It was too cold to use the pool but it looked clean as did the hot tub. THe hotel was well located, just off the main tourist street, close to restaurants and attractions but not noisey or in a high traffic area. Breakfast was adequate and staff (except for a grumpy man who checked us in), helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experence, Wonderful breakfast, Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Meredisney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West with my parents for an overnight get-a-way in December. This was the only reasonably priced hotel my mother could find when booking our trip, plus it was one of the only places that still had rooms available for the night we were going to be in Key West. After hearing where we were staying, I immediately went to tripadvisor and looked it up. I was a little worried after reading the review about the lady who found a worm in her bed. We found this hotel to be ABSOLUTLEY WONDERFUL. As stated before, we traveled with my parents, so we had a total of two rooms. Both rooms were HUGE and located on the 2nd floor. The bath was also HUGE. The bathroom had the usual shower, toilet, and sink; however there was an additional sink and vanity outside of the bathroom door so that two people could get ready at the same time. Both rooms had a little refrigerator. The complimentary breakfast consisted of biscuits with sausage gravy, bagels, toast, fruit, jams & jellies, coffee, hot tea, cereal, and I'm sure I'm forgetting what else they had. We were able to purchase tickets for the Key West Trolley Tour right at the front desk. There are also two computers with complimentary internet access in the lobby. Some reviews have mentioned that itâ€™s a far walk to Duval Street, but we found the walk to be just fine. Weâ€™re 30 and my parents are in their 60â€™s and none of us complained about the walk. Honestly, itâ€™s only two blocks over. Also, when we checked in our room wasnâ€™t ready, so the front desk kept our bags for us. Our boat wasnâ€™t leaving until 6pm the next day so the front desk kept our bags again after we checked out so that we could walk around and enjoy the town without rolling our luggage behind us. The staff was friendly and courteous and went out of their way to ensure we had a nice trip. I highly recommend this placeâ€¦and as far as that picture of the worm, the bedspread in the photograph isnâ€™t even close to the one that we had in our roomâ€¦hahahaha!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Danimal15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find, as long as you're not seeking a huge amount of luxury. The location is perfect - easy to walk to all the sites but in a quiet area away from the commotion. The rooms are large and extremely comfortable (in fact, this room was more comfortable and much larger than the $400 a night room in Miami Beach at the Marriott where we stayed a few nights later). The pool and hot tub are both excellent, the staff is friendly and breakfast isn't anything special but is fine. Our family (my wife and our 9- and 6-year old boys) couldn't have been happier with our choice for a Key West hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bedbugs1000
Reviews.Content: I tell you the Honest, Honest truth.... We went for a long weekend and came home with BED BUGS!!!!! It's 5 MONTHS later and my home is infested with BED BUGS!!!!! I have 4 children ( 2 which are babies) and we are living in HELL! We got them from this hotel during our summer vacation! This has been the most expensive vacation because we had to throw away our mattress, clothes, many personal items and tent our home. We have spent thousands of dollars because of this hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy yet spacious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: garrett678
Reviews.Content: At the southern end of Simonton street lies the Hibiscus Motel/Hotel. Each room is large with two queen sized beds, with a decent sized bathroom, and a minifridge/microwave/coffeemaker. There is a separate sink and large mirror outside the bathroom, which is convenient for ladies to get ready in the morning. The hotel pool is large and clean, with a jacuzzi on the side. Both the pool and jacuzzi are heated, so it is open all year long! The pool closes at midnight, which is great for late night fun!! It serves continental breakfast from 7am to 10 am, which consists of the standard bagels/muffins, coffee/juice, eggs, fruits, and biscuits with gravy. They also have two computers available for people to check their emails and confirm their flights, which was very useful to us. We had a lovely meal at Duffy's, which is about four blocks north on Duval street (one block west of Simonton) and the restaurant is nowhere as pricy as those near Mallory Square. We also rented bicycles from the nearby Moped Hospital, which does most of its business renting out mopeds. The bikes were a little beat up and dated, but they do the job. It was fun riding around the small island, but at night it might be dangerous sharing the streets with cars driving by. We actually saw a car hit a bicyclist as it was turning into a parking lot, knocking the guy down. Luckily no one was hurt and the bicycle was still operational. Mallory Square is very festive and every night there is tons of people looking to go out and have fun. The drag shows looked interesting, but we did not go in. We had dinner at Caroline's on Duval street and the food was pretty good and moderately priced. The walk from the hotel to Mallory Square was a pleasant 10 minute, which is fine for us to walk and shop and buy ice cream on the way room. There is a nice ice cream store called Flamingo Crossing, that was really good ice cream! We were there twice in the two nights that we were at Key West. The beaches were nice and the water is very warm (even in december). However, due to the fine sand, the water by the beach is quite dusty. It was very pleasant nonetheless. We also went snorkeling with Sunset watersports, which has snorkeling trips for 3 hours for 35 dollars a person, which I thought was a good deal, and it included unlimited beverages. Of course, no beer until after snorkeling is finished. People are very relaxed and laid back here. We met some very nice locals, who were eager to interact with tourists and chitchat with us. In New York City, where we are from, that would never happen. On the way home, we took one of the pink taxi's to the airport, which has a standard rate of $8 per person for the airport from the hotel. We actually walked from the airport to the hotel (about 20-30 min walk) after we dropped the car off to Avis the first day. It was tolerable since we were walking by the shore and the beach the entire time. Very lovely. I would visit Key West again and stay at this hotel. It felt spacious and I don't like sharing bathrooms like I would at a B&B (which can be quite expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mainer5
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two days at the motel. The best way for me to describe the Room 217 was it was dated, but very well maintained. The pool was was better than I was expecting prior to arrival. The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start each day off. I used the computer in the lobby each day to e-mail friends. The free parking and computer for e-mail was a big plus with me. The only drawback, was a long walk by foot to the Mallory Square each day from the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Hexthorpe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. It is a block away from the quiet end of Duval St. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: blackhat72
Reviews.Content: Because of the "Meeting of the Minds," the room we were able to get was one of the last available rroms in Key West that night. We were pleasantly impressed with the cleanliness, spaciousness and comfort we experienced. We arrived late and our room was more than we expected. Breakfast was an added plus with all the essentials of a continental service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: wilobe5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is adjacent to Southernmost House. Check-in/Check-out was hassle-free. Room 232 has a nice layout, 2 queen beds and a large kitchenette. The closet was also large with a room safe. With four sharing a room, we appreciated the two sinks (one in, and one outside the bathroom with big mirrors and plenty of counter space). The room was clean and smelled fresh; "Luz" was a great housekeeper. I liked the interior shutters instead of curtains; it added to the "clean" appearance. The grounds were tidy and pool area clean with plenty of chairs.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: blndy5929
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The room was very nice, very clean and comfortable. No doubt would stay here again. We were not real impressed with the breakfast, but not too bad. Hope to be there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, lousy view and bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSweden
Reviews.Content: Having a Best Western membership card you would expect friendly staff. Being a Diamond Member - even more so. I was treated in a non-friendly way, was given a room with a view looking into a wall 3 feet away!!! The cleaners didn't even make the bed properly. Breakfast was better eaten elsewhere! I cannot recommend this hotel in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place for the price”
Reviews.Author: noeliaOrlandoFlorida
Reviews.Content: From the (hot & cold) complimentary breakfast (7am till 10am) to the knowledgeable front desk staff along with free available parking and the clean, comfortable rooms; this is the place to stay!!!!! a block away from the sightseeing trolley (a 2-hr ride of both old and new Key West highlites or make it a day long "get on &/off" for the sights and shopping and eating)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, relaxing, and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: metzer45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days at the Best Western Hibiscus. We loved the large clean rooms. Had 2 queen beds, two comfortable chairs, large desk, tv, refrigerator, microwave, large bathroom with an extra large sink area outside main bath for convenience. It had lovely decor with a big closet, security safe. We could not have asked for more. Staff was helpful and friendly. Free continental breakfast was adequate, nothing fancy. We did not have waffles, but plenty of fruit, muffins, cereal, toast, bagels, juices, coffee, sausage gravy and biscuits. The pool was lovely with tropical flowers, shrubbery and palm trees, several tables and chairs and many lounge chairs. Peaceful and relaxing. Hot tub was a plus. We even had a famous "Key West rooster" wander through the pool area. Easy walk up Duval Street, several restaurants close by, parking for your car and great ambiance. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rainey4
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Key West at this hotel. The room was large with 2 queen beds. Also came with a small fridge and microwave(free popcorn). I think the location is perfect, a block from the beach, and 2 blocks from the southernmost point of the US. A block from Duval Street-on the quiet end. An easy walk to Mallory Square and all of the shops. They gave us a room poolside, so convenient. The free breakfast was great. Waffles to make, hardboiled eggs, muffins and more. Free parking. I have stayed in hotels in Key West costing more than double and not half as nice!!!! Will definitely recommend to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!!”
Reviews.Author: mkdmk5
Reviews.Content: I must say the room was very big. We were on the second floor and it was great. The walk to everything wasn't that bad. It would not have been bad at all if it wasn't 110* out. Yes, record highs! The breakfast left a lot to be desired but there is a Dennys down the road, no big deal. After walking all day the pool was great. The beds were comfortable. I would stay there again. For the price you can't bet it!!! Great stay!! Friendly Staff!!

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: fredgarvinNy
Reviews.Content: a hotel that has 4 walls and a door even a bath that I remember

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value...”
Reviews.Author: smlou
Reviews.Content: We were VERY pleased with our stay. The room was large and had plenty of space to store our toiletries and belongings. We had a room overlooking the pool which besides the great view, was very quiet. The hotel location is at the southern end of the island, but very much within walking distance to most places. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, we thought this was a terrific hotel and would definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great new upgrades”
Reviews.Author: caborja78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past for spring breaks with friends. Now, years later, I took my husband for Memorial Day weekend and decided to give it a try again. This time, they had just completed renovations including the pool, main office, and rooms. before, it was just an "ok" cheaper option for my friends and me. This time, it was not only one of the most affordable options on the island, but also an even nicer/upgraded place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice safe place in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: jas45
Reviews.Content: This is not a "Top Shelf" 4 star hotel but it was clean and we felt very safe in the quieter section of Key West. Office staff were very friendly and helpful. Easy access to the trolley and nice restaurants close by. The negative; no elevator to second floor if your hauling heavy luggage up the steep steps. Nice young man, don't know if he worked there or a guest was very helpful to my wife. We have stayed at other places close by including one the next street over and this has been the nicest at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain place”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamWanderer
Reviews.Content: We drove own to Key West from Orlando. We had spent quite a long time on the internet looking for accommodation. The Best western Hibiscus was one of the few that offered FREE car parking other places were charging up to $20 per night. The Hibiscus is located close to the south end of Duval Street in a quiet area. The conch train is nearby and the walk up Duval Street towards Mallory Square offers lots of interesting shops restaurants and bars. Our room was large with two queen beds. It was very clean, facing the pool and had a safe ,iron and ironing board coffee maker and a TV. Plenty of towels and tolietries . The pool is lovely and available for use from 0700 untl midnight there are plenty of loungers and pool towels available . Breakfast was served in the lobby with a good selection of juices pasteries and fruit. The staff are friendly and we enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - inexpensive short stay.”
Reviews.Author: jemgk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for one extra night in Key West. Rooms are definitely older, but were clean and comfortable for a short stay. Location was very quiet, but could walk to Old Town and most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jessann13
Reviews.Content: Just retunred from a weeks stay at the Best Western Hibiscus and I thought it was great. The rooms were spacious, the air conditioning worked GREAT, and there was free internet access in the rooms. The breakfast in the morning was adequate. Nothing flashy but there was plenty of food for breakfast. The pool was also nice. It was not too far of a walk from the hotel to Duval Street, it took just about 25-30 minutes to walk to Mallory Square and you had plenty of place to stop for a quick drink if you needed a break. Overall, our time at the Hibiscus was great and I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “ugly!”
Reviews.Author: Meadowtraveller
Reviews.Content: good value for key west,but ideally a little to far out from mallory sq.rooms a bit dated need TLC.noisey air con.free continental was good.pool was ok

Reviews.Title: “Great find.”
Reviews.Author: IguanaBabe
Reviews.Content: What a great find! LARGE rooms with full bath plus an additional vanity and sink area which is great when traveling with gal pals or kids. Hotel is just as described on net which is rare. No surprises. Big continental breakfast. Perfect location at southernmost end of island. Since weI live in Florida we travel to Key West several times a year and have stayed at 5 star to 2 star B&Bs and hotels, the Hibiscus is the perfect spot if you are going to be out and about all day and need clean, quiet rooms with plenty of space. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Prime Location & Free Parking in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: bostoncolleen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late July for Hemingway Days Festival, and thought it good value for the money. Had a first floor poolside room for about $110. per night, including free breakfast and free parking. The room had 2 queen beds, mini-fridge, coffee maker, and was nicely designed and updated with a new bathroom w/ 2 sinks. The weekend vibe at the pool (Friday/Saturday) can be a little "spring break" here, with weekdays being a little more quiet, reserved, and family friendly. Great rates when booked in advance directly on Best Western's website, and by joining their free frequent flyer type "race rewards program". (saved 10%) Comfortable walking distance to everything in old town Key West, and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “hotel still nice...there are two sides as far as room goes”
Reviews.Author: musicteachtravel
Reviews.Content: this is my second hotel after being pleased with my first visit. The first time I had a 1st floor room with tile floors, bright colors and a nice bed and paid 259/night in dec. This time I was on the 2nd floor in aug 09 and paid 89.00/night. The difference between the 1st and 2nd floor rooms is huge. The 2nd floor has not been updated as the first. They are still clean, parts of the bathroom are updated but the room as a whole looked dated. The location is great and I will stay again, but will request a 1st floor room.

Reviews.Title: “One block off Duval, oversized rooms, large pool, good deal for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Oneidak
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Best Western. It is older, it is only two stories, and there is no elevator. If you are looking for a fancy, high class resort you're in the wrong place. If you're looking for the best bang for your buck then you've found it. This place is immaculate and the pool is large with one part being over 8 ft deep. You're one block off of Duval where all the restaurants, bars, and shopping is so walking everywhere is definitely an option. The rooms have two queen beds (not those tiny standard size beds) and there's a small fridge and microwave. The rooms are much larger than your standard hotel rooms and there's a vanity and sink outside the bathroom as well as inside. The breakfast is very simple fare with cereal, bagels, toaster waffles, toast, etc. It's not much but it's more than what the other pricier hotels in this area offer. I would recommend eating at Carolines in the 300 block of Duval the food is wonderful! If you have kids bemoaning their fate of having to walk up and down Duval street for hours without a toy in sight I would highly recommend "Imagination Station." It is on Roosevelt between Publix and Sears in a strip shopping center. I can't say enough about this place. It's got the most unique toys I've ever seen! It made the whole trip worthwhile for my kids. This is definitely no Hilton but it had what we valued most; large rooms, large beds, clean, big pool, great location, and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay for a Week”
Reviews.Author: princesspeachy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the week while we were in Key West. We arrived early and were able to check in right away. The one guy at the service desk was a little grumpy, but whatever. Check out was quick and easy. Good location - not far from the beaches and within a block from Duval Street. This was one of the most reasonable hotels we found for the price in Key West. Our room was big. Even with two beds, there was plenty of space. Plus, the microwave, mini fridge, and coffee maker were nice. The entire bathroom area was also roomy and clean. The pool was a decent size and never got overly crowded. They also had a hot tub, but we did not use it. They have free continental breakfast, which was good, and consisted of bagels, waffles, cereal, muffins, and toast. We will stay here again when we go back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “relax in key west”
Reviews.Author: dizzydoris
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days in key west, staying at the Best Western Hibiscus, the hotel is spotless, with large rooms, a fridge and microwave, the pool was very refreshing after a day at the beach, the staff were very friendly and helpful, gave us a map and pencilled in the beaches and recommended restaurants. Breakfast was basic but ok, and hotel had free parking. The hotel is in a quiet area of key west and is easily walkable from Duval street and the old town. I would stay there again. when we were planning our trip we wanted one of the old colonial houses which do b and b, but these are quiet expensive. We were more than happy with Best Western Hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, needs better customer service”
Reviews.Author: felixlynn
Reviews.Content: if you noticed this is from last year, i loved the place and wanted to stay again this year....last year as i was leaving i asked about a group rate as i wanted my whole group of friends to stay there instead of the hotel next door and they said they would certainly give me a good rate and to just call this year.....well i've called, 3 times, i was passed to the managers voicemail and i left a clear concise message and return number, i've heard nothing, i called back 2 other times and the front desk says they can't do anything for me we'll just have to book at whatever rates we find online...now i've worked for 2 hotels as audit and front desk and i know we always had groups come in and gave them at least a lesser aaa rate, or even a regular room rate for a poolside etc....but this place acts like it just doesn't care and thats not the kind of service i expect when i could of brought at least 20 others with me this year......

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tfoster926
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus for 7 days and it was a very nice and clean hotel room, overlooking the pool. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only negative in the entire stay was the toilet in our bathroom - you had to hold the handle down the entire time to get it to flush, other than that, the room was great - roomy, clean, and the A/C worked great! We definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, clean place”
Reviews.Author: bahama_mama_NJ
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, quiet area of town. Rooms were clean. Pool view room on second floor was very nice. Continental breakfast was fast and easy. Nothing special, just good. Toaster bagels and waffles, coffee, juice and milk. Free internet in lobby, 2 desk top machines. Pool was big and clean. A few good restaurants were close by. I would recommend El Siboney on Catherine Street if you like Cuban food.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Clean and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: hndapwr
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hibiscus June 14th - June 17th. We arrived at about 1PM and was told that the room was not ready. We had booked a AAA rate of $89 per night. The front desk person asked for our AAA card and we did not have it. We didn't really think about bringing it as we usually empty our wallets/purses of un needed cards and never before had we been asked to actually present our AAA card. Normally we just enter the numbers when making the reservation and it locks us in. The guy was a little rude about it too. I get it, we should have brought it. He really rubbed us the wrong way with his attitude. I was going to have someone go to our house and fax a copy of our card just to prove to this guy we weren't trying to scam, but I had beer to drink on Duval, so we paid the extra $10 per night. It is a motel type place with exterior corridors, no private balcony. The room was nice and large. King bed with 4 pillows. The A/C worked great. It was super hot the time we were there and it kept up an then some!! There was a little dinette table with 2 chairs, a small fridge and a microwave. There was a nice sized bathroom with a toilet, sink and tub/shower. Outside of that was a good sized vanity area with a sink as well. Lots of room for toiletries! The pool was very nice, although since it is small, it really heats up and was not even really refreshing. Plenty of chairs and loungers. Breakfast was not the high spot. It is a mediocre continental breakfast. Everything seemed to be frozen and out of a box. Certainly would get you started, but we like a more hearty breakfast. This Pittsburgh boy needs his meat. KW has so many great breakfast places, we didn't really mind going out anyway. They have a computer in the lobby that you can use. It is hooked up to a printer so if you want to print coupons or boarding passes, you can. The hotel also offers free wireless high-speed internet in the rooms. The location is good. 1 block from Duval down by the Southernmost point. There is a nice little convenience store/deli across the street that is good for getting a six pack, some chips and a good Cuban sandwich. We walked A LOT staying on that end of Duval, but that did not bother us. If we were too tired, sore, or drunk we would take a cab (which were not expensive). There seemed to be plenty of free parking as well. The place is nothing fancy, but a great value.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here...would happily return!”
Reviews.Author: gobears79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus for 4 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. No problems checking in or out (even though we arrived after 8pm on our first night), plenty of parking, great pool, pretty good room. The only real room complaint we had was a water faucet that would turn on kind of strong, but it wasn't a big deal. We only really had the continental breakfast one day, and it was fine -- hard-boiled eggs, toast/bagels/waffles, cereal, oatmeal, fruit., coffee, tea. I might've liked some yogurt. As you can see, I'm stretching to find anything very negative to say. The location was good for us -- near the Southernmost point/hotel/cafe and Duval. It was a bit of a walk to Mallory Square and that area, but we didn't mind. Would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “worst service of my life”
Reviews.Author: Ms-Travler
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night, hotel was full only because of the swine flu scare in Mexico. I called the front desk about 7:30 and asked for some fresh towels. The witch on the phone refused ,said "if you want towels come up to the desk and get them" I said you dont have anyone to bring to my room at these prices? $200 for on night off season! NO and hung up. I went by the front desk on my way out to ask her name and she called me a Phyco witch, with a" B "said we could check out if we didnt like it there. Knowing I didnt want to start looking for another room, I left for dinner with my husband. The next morning I went to the front dest to check out and she called me a phycowitch again, I tried to take her picture,but she turned away. The room was clean and large,but the personal the worst of my life, Stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hibiscus Motel”
Reviews.Author: Amy256
Reviews.Content: A friend and I started our Florida vacation in Amelia Island working our way to Saint Augustine, Miami, Key West and finally Jacksonville to return home. All our stays were at Best Western properties. The Hibiscus Motel was the best we stayed in large room 112 with two queen beds, two comfy chairs and a coffee table, fridge and microwave complete with popcorn and iron/board. The bathroom was supplied with lots of towels and a second large sink area made it easy for two people to get ready in the morning. The pool area was very clean and had many lounge chairs and three tables with umbrella's and chairs. Free internet was supplied in the lobby. Breakfast was continental ceral, hard boiled eggs, waffles, toast, juice and fruit. Check in/out was done quickly with minimum of fuss. The Hibiscus is located on the quiet end of Durval St towards the Southernmost sign post. The sighseeing trolly stops a block away from the hotel or the walk to Mallary square is interesting too. Key West was a great place to visit and I would stay at the Hibiscus again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelynn01
Reviews.Content: For value and convenience of location, I was pretty sure I had made a good choice for the four of us (husband and two daughters). But upon arrival, I found many other wonderful "perks" at the Hibiscus. We got a room on the second floor right above the lobby (Room 232, I think), which had a large deck with two round tables and some chairs directly outside our door and the room next to us, so if we had wanted to sit out and relax and enjoy the view, we could have. But we were too busy taking advantage of the motel's easy access to the town of Key West! We were so excited to have finally arrived at our destination, that we immediately set down our suitcases in the HUGE room (two queen beds w/kitchenette), and set off in one direction, not knowing where we'd end up. It happened to be south and towards the "most southern point of Key West" where a small line of tourists had formed to get photographed at the site, and we took advantage of the photo opportunity as well. Along the way we strolled past attractive homes with lush tropical vegetation, and often got a friendly nod or hello from passersby. The Best Western Hisbiscus proved to be a perfect location for us. In our short (too short!) stay there on June 1st and 2nd, we traversed up and down all of Duvall and its sidestreets. Mallory Square at the far end of Duvall is just a mile away and anyone in decent shape (and with good walking shoes) can make the walk easily. There is also a scooter rental nearby which we took advantage of one afternoon. The area around the motel was quiet and the hotel grounds around the pool area were beautifully landscaped which made for two relaxing mornings to sit out and enjoy their more than adequate continental breakfast before we set out for the day. With three females in our family, we really appreciated the roominess of our accommodations and having three sinks and multiple mirrors when getting ready in the morning or going out for the evening! For less than $110/night, this was a great value!!! The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, and I loved the shutters on the windows instead of blinds. The people in the lobby were very helpful with suggesting retaurants in the area. If we return to Key West (and we miss it already!), the lovely pastel peach Best Western Hibiscus Motel at 1313 Simonton Street is where we'll head!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: San1976
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, big rooms (free popcorn haha) , nice swimmingpool. Breakfast was included en was ok. Close to duval street, hemmingway house and southmostern point. Free parking

Reviews.Title: “Would try somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: crazygecko
Reviews.Content: This was the least favourite of the 5 hotels we stayed in on our two week trip to Florida. We managed to park our car easily but we were low season and parking was limited so in high season this may be more of an issue. We were given a room right in the far corner of the hotel facing the road, car park and cleaning shed, as we were only staying one night this was not too much of an issue but had we been staying longer.....The room itself was basic and motel like and we had ants in the bathroom. The pool was great and it was lovely that it was open at night so the children could swim even after eating out. Breakfast was as you would expect at this sort of hotel, bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, juice etc, however, there was no where near enough seating to accomodate everyone so even though the sign said it was not allowed we ate next to the pool, along with several others. This hotel is far enough away from the bars and clubs that it is within walking distance of the action, unless you have small children then I would advise taking the car anyway as it is further than you want to have to carry them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsfleww
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (Apr 22 -24) and found this hotel to be a lovely place to stay. Room was very large and clean. King size bed on second floor. Pool area was very nice. We walked everywhere and didn't get in the car until we left. Very convenient location. Would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place ....”
Reviews.Author: AriDeu
Reviews.Content: Being unsure about this place at first, being that it is listed with one star and as a motel, we booked the Hibiscus after we read a lot of great reviews and could not agree more. We travelled through various cities in FL and loved this place the most. Great big clean rooms (we were a group of four) and extremely friendly staff. The locations is excellent, one block from the Southernmost House and Point and a short walk to the night life on Duval. A little deli store and also a souvenir/tourist store, where you can book and get on little tours around the island are right across the street. A big big plus are also the included breakfast and free parking. This place deserves more than one star from us and we would stay there again anytime. The Hibiscus fits right into the great laid back fun atmosphere of Key West. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “It has everything!”
Reviews.Author: KeepsmilingNC
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge with every amenity we could ask for. The pool area was wonderful and never too crowded. The location couldn't have been better. It was in a quiet area, yet we could walk to all the attractions. There was a small shopping center nearby, which came in handy when we didn't want to go to the tourist area for a bite to eat. And there was a trolley stop two minutes away to get an overview of the whole area. We even discovered a quiet, local beach about 5 minutes away by car. Overall, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rhsparkle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Wstern Hibiscus Motel Apr 21 & 22. Everything was great. 1 mile from Mallory Square. Enough breakfast options for free. Room was clean. Liked theshutters on the windows instead of the normal curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel not far from centre”
Reviews.Author: jayarrscott
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 3 nights while attending daughter's wedding in Key West.. The motel was clean and comfortable. We use the pool a few times & it was good. Breakfast was good and there was free internet. Altogether a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: sandseaDracut_MA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days here and it was wonderful :))) The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and smelled great, too...no stale, musty, aroma at all:))) Our room had not only the full bath, but a sink area outside the bath that was handy. The fridge and a microwave were great conveniences. Breakfast was yummy...cereals, muffins, waffles, toasts, fruit, eggs, bagels, and juices. There is fresh coffee in the lobby area all day. Internet there, too. (They were having a problem with the new printer) Large, beautiful pool and a nice spa that seats 4. It was only 1 block from Duval St and was very quiet. 20 min walk to Mallory Square for all the sunset fun. I would go back here anytime :))))

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - HORRIBLE beds (rock hard to be exact)”
Reviews.Author: MotherEarth888
Reviews.Content: Great location but not worth the unfriendly service (one nice lady, Rita) nor worth the awful beds (the tags are cut off so you cannot tell the dates of them). Housekeeping is sparce (they didn't even change the trash) nor vacuum the sand. If you drink/stay out all night you might not notice the beds. But, for the price ($189/$250) - recommend staying some other location in the Southernmost area.

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentTraveler10
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in room 219, second floor, corner location. Room was very big, well lit, nicely furnished in good shape and clean. Double queen beds very nice but AC was somewhat noisy, fan ran all the time as compressor cycled on and off. Extra sink and counter area outside of bathroom was very handy. Has small microwave, refrigerator and safe. TV and cable selection was good and wireless worked well. Was quiet, convenient to pool, lobby, parking area and street. Plenty of on site parking. Pool area was very nice, good size and well maintained. Plenty of lounges and nice hot tub. The continental breakfast was adequate but nothing special. Some room locations are certainly not as nice as the one we were in but staff seemed willing to move people around as rooms became vacant. Location in southern area of KW is quieter but further away from action at other end of Duval St. We took local bus one time at cost of $.50/ea (for over 60's) and could've used it some more but didn't. Some colorful locals rode with us and were very friendly and helpful. Drove our rental car to Mallory Sq. one night and paid $10.00 to park in local lot. Street parking is $.25 for each 10 minutes or $1.50/hour. Some areas have street side parking machines that will take credit card. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance as well as Hemingway house (a good take),Lighthouse Museum, scooter and bike rentals, etc. Local beaches aren't much, but Keys are not known for beaches.

Reviews.Title: “First Time To Key West”
Reviews.Author: gemstones3240
Reviews.Content: My wife did a lot of research on hotels in Key West and we decided to go with a 'safe' brand. We weren't disappointed. The staff, for the most part was good. I heard them talk to a few guests as if they didn't need their business, but over all, we had a good experience. It also seemed as if the housekeepers were told not to talk to the guests. They never said anything to anyone that I could see. The lobby area was always very neat. It also doubled as the 'business center' and the breakfast room. The housekeepers always kept it clean and neat. The two floors of rooms surround the pool area. The pool was very nice and well used by the guests. There is a hot tub and the deep end of the pool goes to over 8 feet. You don't find that often anymore. The rooms were very clean and neat. The floors didn't have carpet, which I found odd. I'm not sure I've ever stayed in a hotel with hard floors. But once I thought about it, it's very practical for the staff. Not a turn off. The air conditioners are loud, but they make great 'white noise' for people and carts that go by your door. There was plenty of parking. On a final note, when we go back to Key West, which I'm sure we will one day, we will probably look at one of the older hotels. There were tons of smaller and cheaper places to stay. We truly didn't see any that we wouldn't have stayed in. The Best Western Hibiscus is in a good location. Duval street is a long street, so if you have a stroller or small kids, you might want to drive. We actually rented an electric car. Everyone does. :) Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “When in Key West, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: bonniewabbitt
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay when in Key West. Friendly and helpful staff. A gorgeous swimming pool. Great location; walking distance to many attractions on the island. Very nice complimentary breakfast. Quiet, pretty relaxed setting. This place is "the one.!"

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hibiscus Motel”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldo12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Key West and had a great time at Best Western Hibiscus Motel !!! Don't let the word motel turn you down. It has nothing to do with the place. Huge rooms, very clean all over, fresh breakfast and great location. Will definitely come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Roomy, Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum1110
Reviews.Content: 2 of my friends and I stayed at the Hibiscus for one night to kick off our Spring Break celebration. Although we were searching for a cheap, clean hotel to put us up for the day and night as we explored the beaches, town, and Duval Street, we were VERY pleasantly surprised! The hotel room was bigger than expected and very clean! For resting purposes, we chose Key West's "quieter" side of town and I'm glad we did. Mallory Square was about a 20 minute walk. All the bars & restaurants on Duval were between a 10 & 20 minute walk. Everything was so close and we had a wonderful time. The only complaint would be the $250/night charge that I'm sure the hotel managers could not help because it was the weekend AND Spring Break opener. Also, there was a $500 hold put on a credit card just so the room was not trashed, but we had no problem with that because we are not the "typical" Spring Breakers! If you are looking for a clean, friendly, relaxing, and resonably priced place to stay for a few nights in Key West to enjoy the Island's attractions, then this hotel is the one for you! PS - The pool/hot tub looked wonderful, but we did not have time to enjoy it =(

Reviews.Title: “This Best Western was G-R-E-A-T!!”
Reviews.Author: Riis_7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we thought it was only a couple of blocks from Sloppy Joe's on Duval Street and because of the great reviews. We found out after the reservation was made that it is actually a little further than 1 mile away. Turned out we were pleased with the hotel even though it was further away than we expected. This is certainly nothing a taxi cab wouldnâ€™t fix, or as we found out â€“ the walk wasnâ€™t bad at all â€“ even after a long day of standing in line for a concert. This hotel is clean, quiet, comfortable, and very near the water. I woke up, took a 3 block walk to the ocean and watched the sunrise. Another 3 blocks you will be at the southern most point â€“ great photo opportunity there. Although youâ€™ll find that most of the hotels in the Keys are near the ocean â€“ this was a really great find. The pool was very inviting, as was the Jacuzzi. I did not get to use the pool but the Jacuzzi was nice â€“ it would have been nicer had the water been hotâ€¦it was more a luke warm. As far as the room goes â€“ WONDERFUL! We had a room with 2 queen beds on the second floor (#222). The rooms are nicely furnished and windows had plantation shutters. There is a bathroom with a shower, toilet & sink/mirror. Then there is a second sink/vanity just outside the bathroom doorâ€¦boy did this come in handy â€“ we had 4 people in the room. The beds were comfortable and there were extra pillows/blanket in the closet if needed. The room also has a coffeemaker which I appreciated very much. The water pressure was good too. The included breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, milk, cereal, oatmeal, mini muffins, several bread choices (butter, jam, etc.) and Belgian waffles. While it wasnâ€™t deluxe, it certainly was more than adequate. I didnâ€™t get to meet the crusty old man that some have commented aboutâ€¦.maybe next time. Because I would stay here again ~ and would recommend it to my best friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jnjm
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel in Key West. We were very satisfied with our choice ...which we picked because of previous TripAdvisor reviews. It was a great location and we walked everywhere. It was about 20/25 minute walk to Mallory Square; only one block over from Duval Street. The price was right. We had a king bed on the 2nd floor and the room was quite large. It was average decor but definitely clean. Would definitely stay again. I do agree though that the wireless wasnt the best, but when we checked in they did warn us about that. The continental breakfast was fine...pretty much what you get everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale. Clean.”
Reviews.Author: vidwerk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Walking distance to attractions. Clean. Nice room overlooking courtyard pool area. My only complaint was the wifi. Kept cutting out.

Reviews.Title: “Just liked they said”
Reviews.Author: Jan&Dean
Reviews.Content: After researching the Key West hotels we settled on this hotel because of the mostly positive reviews. The place is perfect, clean, big rooms, microwave, fridge in room and best of all free parking . Upon registering "the older crusty man" that has been mention before in another review, noticed that my wife was using a cane and switched our room to one that had a "walk in shower". That was very thoughtful. Later that night I called the desk and this same man answered. I asked him if you knew where I could find a "New York Style Pizza", He answered why would you want one of those? I replied that I was from that area and liked them. He said then why don't you go home and get one. This is Key West he added. I laughed as I hung up the phone and used the hotel restaurant listing to find a pizza. The next day I had to rent a wheelchair for my wife, and the front desk was very helpful in locating one. We wheeled down to the Square everyday and visited all the sights. It's only a short walk. After returning at night I went out to the hot tub and found three others from the northern states out in this 60 degree weather, all relaxed and very friendly. When I return to Key West this is the only place I would book again. This is the best deal for the price range. I know I have stayed at other Key West lodgings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay- one of the best”
Reviews.Author: ssooss
Reviews.Content: There was very little we didn't like about this hotel. We booked a King room and it was huge. the bathroom had a sink of its own, plus there was a vanity outside it. The room was near the street but we heard no street noise. There were plenty of towels and toiletries; the room had Wifi, a refrigerator, and a microwave, in addition to the usual coffee pot, hairdryer and ironing board. the pool and hottub are inside a courtyard which was great for keeping the wind out ( we were there the week they had record cold temps and 20-30 mph winds.) We always found a parking spot near our room, and the staff were always friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ok, not gourmet by any means, but we ate there 3 days. the only complaint we could have about the room was the lighting. it seemed a little dim, because the windows had plantation shutters on them, so when we opened them, people could look right in at us. The hotel itself is located at the "other end" of Duval St. However, its only a mile walk all the way to the other end, (which I did several times, even though i was on crutches). there are also plenty of restaurants and shops near that end of Duval street. I have already recommended this hotel to two friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: redhead03
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this Best Western Hibiscus in Key West for it's good value, great location and spacious rooms. The pool was inviting and sparkling clean. The grounds were well manicured and the staff attentive. Parking was adequate and the free breakfast was nice. Compared to some of the B&B's in Key West, you won't find anything with such large rooms with a resort-like pool and patio area. We'll be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Place; Price too high”
Reviews.Author: LSC06
Reviews.Content: This is an attractive, two story motel style hotel that appears to be updated and well kept. There is an attractive pool with lots of seats in the center. It's in a very good location for walking to the southern end of the island and up Duval street. In the evening the front desk is staffed by a crusty, funny old fellow who seems a perfect match for the island attitude. Parking and breakfast are included in the price. We thought our price was too high for such a property, but did get a very nice room that included a small sitting area and a small kitchen with frig. and microwave. We had lots of space. The breakfast was a regular Best Western type, and fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveller1917
Reviews.Content: We booked this for two reasons: location and price. The hotel didn't let us down on either count. Duval Street and all the madness of Key West bars and restaurants were only a short walk away, but the area around the hotel itself was lovely and peaceful. The pool area was a bit retro but very relaxing. Unfortunately, the room stank of damp. Not unheard of in Florida but still unpleasant especially as the smell leeched into our clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieKathy
