Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Very centrally located to Key West. We took a taxi to main area of town only around $6 but you could also walk it easily but I was with my 75 year old mum. Hotel was beautiful lovely rooms and pool. My daughter loved the free internet so she could talk to friends. Free breakfast which was your toast and pastries which was plenty for us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: NeverUnpacked
Reviews.Content: Another good choice, thanks to you other reviewers. The property is in a relatively quiet area two blocks from the southernmost point, and a few blocks from the public beach. The "active" part of Duval street was about a mile north, but very walkable for us (my 78 year old Uncle was my travel partner for this trip). A late night cab ride was $5. Check-in was quick and friendly (initially, we were very early and they weren't ready for us, but they let us park the car and start our day). We purchased an Old Town Trolley ticket at the counter and used the trolley both as a tour and day transportation to downtown, since the stop was a block away. Our room overlooked the pool and was very large and clean, with comfortable beds, a microwave and fridge. Noise wasn't an issue during our stay. The pool area was very well maintained and a relaxing area. The breakfast selection seemed a bit limited, but was only a minor negative. We were looking for a simple, clean, comfortable room and this turned out to be one of the top travel values that I've recently encountered. Had our schedule allowed it, we would have extended our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, depressing room”
Reviews.Author: GirlMouse
Reviews.Content: From the outside this motel looks very nice, and also the pool area was much better than in most other motels. The room, however, was a very typical motel room and actually rather depressing. Complimentary breakfast was ok. I kind of ended up having no other option but to book this motel, due to the fact that during Thanksgiving, almost every other hotel in Key West seemed to have a 2-3 night minimum stay requirement. I just wanted to stay for one night and quickly see Key West. The location was good for that, so this motel served its purpose ok. Next time I would try some of those boutique hotels that Key West is so famous for.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: SL5
Reviews.Content: The reviews I studied were good, but the Hibiscus was even better. Spotless, great ambience, lovely staff members, excellent location, huge rooms with everything you could need. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakota
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on our first trip to Key West - had to book 2 rooms for our family of 5, but rates were reasonable online. The rooms were HUGE and clean. Pool area was very nice. We were there before actual check in time, but they were able to get us into rooms within 30 minutes of our arrival. As I had not been to Key West before, had no idea if this was a location close to the action, but it was perfect for us. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, and good pool”
Reviews.Author: ladysmoosh
Reviews.Content: First time I've been to Key West. Had a very good time. This motel was not in the middle of "the action", but still close enough to enjoy it. The rooms were clean and spacious and staff was helpful and courtious. The pool was a pretty decent sized pool for the area. They offer a continental breakfast which was good. Every morning they had an abundance of bagels, waffles, toast, hard boiled eggs, assorted muffins, and hot and cold cereals whch they constantly refilled when needed. Clean and well maintained. The available computor was great to check emails. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hibiscus. We have been quite satisfied on each occasion. The rooms are spacious, the hotel is quite and clean, the location is away from the Duval Street party scene but an easy walk to Duval Street and Mallory Square as well as anyplace else in old town Key West that you'd want to go. There's a small beach at the end of the street, but we didn't actually check it out. It is just a couple of blocks to the Southernmost point in the U.S. for the de rigueur picture. Nice planting around the pool area, easy parking. My only complaint this time was that the water in the hot tub was pretty tepid, even for me who doesn't like excessively hot hot tubs. When we go to Key West, I never look anywhere else as long as I can get a decent rate at the Hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: eveana
Reviews.Content: We read so many good reviews here, we decided to stay at the HB best western in Key West. I am so glad we did. The place was very nice, very clean. Our room was huge. Even with our bikes in the room we had plenty of room. The breakfast in the morning was good. Just enough to get your day started. The location couldnt be better, a block off the main strip makes it easy to walk to everything but also far enough you dont hear the hustle and bustle. When I go back to Key West I would definitely stay again. They take very good care of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, Fab, Fab!!!”
Reviews.Author: McBunny1972
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great rooms, great staff! We arrived at the Best Western Hibiscus after a long drive from Miami, we were early but they let us check in & upgraded our room for nothing. You could not ask for a better location, one block from Duval Street, so most of the interesting stuff inKey West is within walking distance including lots of nice bars & restaurants. The breakfast, unlike a lot of other hotels we stayed in whilst in Florida, was also very good. I would highly reccomend this hotel for a stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Best Western Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: imap316
Reviews.Content: I went to Key West during the Halloween weekend and was very pleased with the BW Hibiscus. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Even the continental breakfast in the mornings were filling. The location was in a quiet location, about a 10 min walk to Truman & Duval Street (far enough to have a peaceful sleep but close enough that a cab is not even really needed-unless you're going to Mallory Square). Rates were a little high for a smaller property, but it was the JB Parrothead convention that weekend also, so its understandable. Next time I make a drive down that way, I will definately stay at the BW Hibiscus. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - great rates”
Reviews.Author: pleasantbear
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on several Key West hotels, I decided on the BW-Hib and glad to report that it was a wise choice. The other hotel that I was considering was the Blue Marlin (due to cost - less than 130 a night...). While I did not see the interior of the rooms a the BM, the BW-Hib pool and area were far nicer and larger than the BM's, just fyi if you find yourself comparing these hotels... The room, 2nd floor, had a king bed and the room was very spacious. There is no smoking in any of the rooms so there was no foul smoke stench - yeah... the room had a sink and vanity outside of the bathroom which also had a full sink and counter too. Made it easier in the AM to get ready having two sinks. The room (225) was not facing the pool directly, but was on the interior section of the hotel (non street facing). The room had a mini fridge which made bring back snacks, pop, water etc convenient. Housekeeping left towels and plenty of shampoo and soap every time. The towels are on the rough side if you are use to plush towels. As others have stated, the pool area is large, the pool goes from 3 feet to 8.5 feet deep. Note that the only smoking section of the hotel is in the pool area, so you do have to deal with 2nd hand smoke when the wind blows. Yes I am an ex-smoker so I am super sensitive to the odor... The pool area is active, but large enough not to feel over crowded. Unfortunately, during our stay, a large group of young adults (late 20's - mid 30's) were there at the same time. They had a habit of going down to the pool early in the AM and putting items on the chairs and tables with umbrellas and leaving to reserve the prime locations. When they did show up, they even brought down an ipod radio so the rest of the pool area could listen to their music. They had a couple of guys that were 'loud' and made sure everyone in the area knew what they were talking about... no clue and just no class. The reason to bring this up is that the BW-Hib is one of the nicest & affordable hotels, so you will have individuals staying at the same location that are on the lookout for a cheap stay and to party hard... The hotel servers a continental breakfast: toast, mini-muffins, bagels, waffles, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, juice & coffee. Enough to tide you over for a day at the pool or walking Duval... The hotel is located two blocks away from the 'most southern point' landmark. Duval Street is two miles and the BW-H is at the far end... Sloppy Joes, Captain Tonyâ€™s and the Hog's Breath saloon(s) are at the other end of Duval so be aware. Everything is within walking distance. There is a CVS within walking distance and a party store/deli just south of the hotel too. I too recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice affordable room in a quieter part of town.

Reviews.Title: “big room”
Reviews.Author: royyech
Reviews.Content: rooms are big, swiming pull is large enough. the location is a big problematic - on the side of duvla street, but not where everything is happaning,

Reviews.Title: “Short and sweet”
Reviews.Author: kschm
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were attending a conference in Miami so decided to fly in to Key West for a two night stay prior to the event. Due to the remnants of hurricane Ike, we got stuck in Atlanta and couldn't get in until late the next day. It was a miserable trip initially but upon arrival at the Best Western Hibiscus, things began to turn around. We immediately went to our rooms to change out of the clothes we'd been wearing for 24 hours and found lovely CLEAN accomodations. As has been said from other posts, the rooms are huge. And as I said, CLEAN!! For being located in a buggy, humid climate I was amazed to find the entire property spotless. The nice cool room was a welcome respite to the 85% humidity and heat. We enjoyed the nice assortment of complimentary breakfast items which got us fueled up for a busy day. The property is located in a great part of town - easy walking distance to everything. And since parking is at a premium - it was nice to park our car (free) at the hotel and then get the Key West experience by foot. Our only disappointment was that our trip was cut short due to airline issues. This means we need to visit Key West again and will certainly book at the BW Hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: alaskaguy44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at here for three nights and it was one of the best values we have come across. The hotel is well maintained, clean, comfortable and convenient. Parking is free and just a stone's throw away. Our room, with two queen beds, was large with two comfortable chairs, a nice desk, two sinks (one outside the bathroom), microwave, mini-fridge and a spacious absolutely clean bathroom. The pool was 50 feet away. It is obvious that the owners or management takes pride in this property. The breakfast was the ordinary continental breakfast and even the coffee from the dispenser was better than average. We could not find fault with anything! It was the best hotel bargain we have found in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices, rooms and service!!”
Reviews.Author: britterich
Reviews.Content: On the advice of others here we booked a room for five days at the Best Western Hibiscus and we loved it! My husband, our two kids and I didn't feel like we were "on top of each other" in the room - the room was very spacious. Our room was above the office so we had a deck area right outside our room with a table and chairs which was nice to sit at and just relax. The kitchen area was a nice plus and gave us room to keep snacks, drinks and leftovers from meals. Housekeeping was amazing and made sure they always left us plenty of towels which is always a plus. The pool area was very nice and even though there were a lot of people out there it didn't feel crowded. Having a sink in the actual bathroom, outside the bathroom and in the kitchen made getting ready for the day a snap. The continental breakfast was great, always well stocked and was perfect for us to have a bite before we started our day. The housekeeping staff stayed on top of keeping everything clean and stocked even at the height of the breakfast rush. Lacy in housekeeping was awesome and it was always a pleasure to see her each day. Dave at the front desk was helpful and kept us updating on everything going on since Tropical Storm Fay was headed our way. We did not meet one person who worked here that was not nice and professional. Everything is within walking distance and I felt very safe. I can't wait to come back here again and I wish we would have spent the last two days of our vacation here rather than in Ft. Lauderdale. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice affordable room in the quieter part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: breanda79
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day trip to Key West and I have to admit I was initally apprehensive about this hotel. We were traveling with a group of friends and this hotel was their choice. We booked the AAA rate which was only $116/night and was far less expensive than most other hotels we looked at. Typically you get you what you pay for so you can understand my apprehension. We arrived early on Wednesday and to our surprise we were welcomed in and checked in right away despite our early arrival. Our room was beautiful! It had recently been renovated and the new ammenities were very nice. New tile throughout and beautiful sinks and vanities. We had a small refrigerator and the AC was ice cold which is important in the Keys in July! We were steps from the pool which was also very nice and quite large. I have to say we had the nicest room out of our friends so if you have an option book 128. The lobby area was also very nice and a continental breakfast was provided daily. Nothing too fancy but it saved us from having to spend extra money on breakfast. The location is right next to the Southernmost Point which is a block from Duvall. There are good bars and restaurants in walking distance but the main party center is at the other end of the strip so be prepared if you are not one for walking. Cab rides are very inexpensive though so overall it's a great location. (Hot dog vendor on the corner was yummy!) If you are looking for an inexpensive retreat in Key West this is it! Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “huge room”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: Really huge room We stayed here for two nights in July. The room was huge, but make sure you donâ€™t get room number 126 if you are there for more than a couple of days. It is located under the stairs and gets no day light what so ever. As we only where there a short period this was ok, but after the 2 days it really started to bother me. We found the hotel to be really good value â€“ thank you to the people here on TA who recommended it to us. The pool was large and clean and the breakfast was as good as you can expect from a place where it is free. Plenty of fresh bagels, waffles to toast, fruit etc etc. The location was ok, close to Duval with all the shopping and restaurants. We could walk everywhere from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: TravisT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a great rate for the week here. Property is okay, pool is fine, room is fine, but location is great. A reasonable walk from Duval Street's main attractions, but that is a good thing before and after a big meal or some drinks. Hemingway House and Southernmost Point are very close. Plus no noise. You aren't staying at a resort, but then again you aren't paying for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: norttim
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel over internet without knowing much about it , just had to trust what other people had written. Thank you , other people ! It was really great place ! Our room was very spacious and clean ( which is the most important thing to me ) .There were also a fridge, TV of course,safe,air conditioner and there was free int.access.Also continental breakfast was included! Location was perfect.Everything was just what I expected and even better !

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Travel_Lover
Reviews.Content: Our family of three enjoyed our stay in Key West. Not only was the room rate a value, but it also included breakfast! The double-bed room was large and included a refrigerator and microwave oven for convenience. These features were a welcome change from the 4-star resort we had just left, where we had to tip everyone and pay for every amenity. I highly recommend this motel for travelers seeking a comfortable, affordable home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great loc. away from the noise but within short distance to great dining”
Reviews.Author: aspen1
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and I from Pikesville,MD stayed at this Best Western for 3 nites in May,2008. Large room with a living room overlooking the very clean pool. Fridge and microwave in the room. Room was very clean. Parking was on a lot at the hotel and was free. Hardly moved the car. Walked up and down Duval doing plenty of shopping and sightseeing. Hotel was away from the noise. Within short walking distance to great restaurants like Duffy's Steak and Lobster and Camilles for breakfast ,I believe available from 8 to 3 pm. Front desk was friendly and professional with many good recommendations for dining. Airconditioning was fantastic. We will definitely stay here again the next time we return. Thank you trip advisor for helping us pick this great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: ooookch
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a nice hotel if you want to be in a more quiet area of Key West without being too far away from the centre. However if you want to walk to the Mallard Square area for example to watch the sunset it takes at least half an hour. The rooms were typical motel rooms; ok in size and amenities and clean. The pool area was nice but can get soon overcrowded. Breakfast is nothing special and the room for breakfast is way too small.

Reviews.Title: “Best for that area”
Reviews.Author: TXMike
Reviews.Content: Although I said I would never stay at a Best Western again after my experience in Colorado Springs, this hotel was the best price in the general area of Key West that I wanted. So, I took a chance. And ... was pleasantly surprised. It was a nice hotel at a decent price for Key West (but that is not saying much ... Key West is more expensive than Maui!). It is about 14-15 blocks from the main tourist area in Key West (in other words, Mallory Square and dock area). However, the Lighthouse museum, Butterfly Conservatory, and Southernmost Point marker are all close. For getting around in Key West, they really need to provide something better than what they have. Although there is bus service, none of the hotel, etc. people recommend it. The BW does NOT have shuttle service to the airport, so that means taxi which is EXPENSIVE! (One person was $14.15 coming from the airport and $12.35 going back ... I have no idea why the meter was different, but I do not trust taxis anyway unless it is a flat rate. Flat rate airport fee is only for two or more people.)

Reviews.Title: “Great, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Lake_travelers
Reviews.Content: Fresh and clean, no musty smells, nice pool, room decor needs a little updating. Small refrigerator and microwave, good TV. No fan in the bathroom, only a window for ventilation, causes problems at times. Air conditioner was weak but adequate. Breakfast was ordinary, with cereals, fruits, toast and bagels, warm hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, coffee. The front desk was very helpful and friendly, very willing to suggest restaurants, attractions and directions. Computer was provided for internet access, and although we did not use it, wi fi was available. Great location a few blocks from the southernmost point and one block off Duval at the quiet end of the island. It was an easy walk to the busy end of the island, a maximum of 13 blocks. Taxis can get you to the busy side for about $8 if you don't want to walk. Plenty of good restaurants within four or five blocks. We would stay here again, it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: kaniasty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. Our breakfast was included, and there is a heated pool in the hotel. Our room was large, and parking is included, since this is a motel. The staff was very helpful both at checkin, and they recommended and helped us book a snorkeling boat trip. As far as the location... the hotel is a 10 minute walk from Hemingway House, and about a 20 minute walk from the marina area, so it's not the most convenient if you're planning on spending all your time on that side, but, like I said, it is still a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel away from the crowds of Duval St”
Reviews.Author: tingles
Reviews.Content: Booked on Tripadvisor recommendation as part of our 3 and half week tour of Florida. Stayed here for 2 nights in April and now wished we had booked for longer. Hotel was fine and clean but nothing special. It had a nice warm pool and breakfast was served inside by reception and was adequate. Pool area with hot tub did not have many sun beds but we always managed to get beds eventually as most people tended not to stay inn the hotel during the day. The hotel is right opposite the Southernmost Hotel and 1 block from Duval St. Be aware that to get to the â€˜happeningâ€™ end of Duval St and Mallory Square its quite a hike, but if you leave yourself half an hour for a slow walk that should do it. I actually liked being a bit away from all the noise and party goers and if you are too tired or drunk to walk back at the end of the evening you can get a taxi bike as we did which was great fun! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we next visit Key West, which we fell in love with

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating, but not to bad”
Reviews.Author: Tslammer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BWH April 3rd and 4th, My wife noticed a damp smell as soon as we entered the room, I dismissed it as her imagination at first. The room was clean and spacious, but the furnishing's could use some updating. We stayed in 117 which had a tile floor which we did not care for. The beds definatly needed replacing as the matresses both had a concave appearance and when you slept both people rolled toward the center of the bed. The pool area is excellent and the breakfast is good (hard boiled eggs, begals, cereals, waffles ect..) location is great close to southern most point and 1/2 block from trolley stop and bike/scooter rental. I noticed the damp smell more by the second day and wondered if a second floor room was better. after reading previous post I guess not. I would stay here again, as it was not to bad but may try another hotel if price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stayl”
Reviews.Author: MallorcaEurope
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location! Near the beach and away from the noisy areas of Key West. The motel itself could do with a little renovation. There was a damp smell in both our rooms even though they where located on the second floor. The staff isnÂ´t very helpful. Not much help to finding the best beach, (south beach nice, good restaurant and very close) or other things. We missed a bar or possibility to buy beverages and snacks by the pool and the staff was very keen on telling you not to have any drinks (nonalcoholic) by the pool. The breakfast was poor, better to go to the little cafÃ© around the corner - wonderful breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llamacalmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights during our trip to Miami. When we first checked in the front desk lady managed to ignore us for quite a while while chatting to other Americans who came in after us. Besides that we had no complaints. Hotel is in a good positon at the quiet end of Duval Street and not too far from southern most point. Room was large, clean and well set out. Breakfast was more than adequate with waffles, bagels, hard boiled eggs and cereal. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: biver
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hibiscus in Key West and loved it! We were in the Keys for our daughter's wedding and decided to spend a few extra nights enjoying the Keys. We spent a night in three different areas. Our last night before the wedding was in Key West at the Hibiscus. We arrived earlier than check in time but the receptionist said she would try to get us in our room within an hour. She quietly said to check back in about a half hour. Well, we decided to walk down to Southernmost Point and then we happened upon Southernmost Cafe. Needless to say, we did not get back to the Hibiscus for about two hours, and when we did, our room was ready. We had a huge room with a sitting area with a television, a small dining area with a table and chairs, a small kitchen with microwave and refrigerator. The bedroom had a king size bed with another television and the bathroom was big and just great. There was even an extra sink outside of the bathroom proper. The entire room was very clean, and was not noisy. We were on the second floor near the checkin lobby and out the bedroom window was the pool area, but there was not any problem with noise from the pool area, even though there were some Spring Break kids staying there. I have to admit that we were not in our room all that much as we soon headed downtown and did not return until well after midnight, but I definitely would return to the Hibiscus on any return visits. It is quite a walk to downtown and all the attractions, but it was beautiful weather and you can take your time walking. We thorougly enjoyed our day and night in Key West and do plan a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLoverAshburnVA
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our two day stay at this hotel. The service was great, great location (we walked to Duval street several times). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: jr89
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hibiscus Motel for five days in February 2008 and were really pleased with the accommodation. Situation is excellent as it is at the "quiet" end of town but still within walking distance of everything . Our room was huge with two beds, two wash basins and excellent bathroom. Check in staff were good and changed the type of room we had requested to a different one with no problem. The room had wifi but here was also broadband access with printer freely available in the lobby. The buffet breakfast was perfectly acceptable with large bowls of fruit as well as the usual cereals. House keeping was the best we came across during our three weeks in Florida and staff always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: ConnTravelor
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Best Western Hibiscus Motel and thought it was a great value in a good location. The motel is located a block off of the quiet end of Duval Street. The motel was clean and quiet. It is a small motel with a hot tub and large (and very warm) pool with palm trees around... which made us just want to grab a chair and a book and relax. You can rent bikes next door. With limited parking in town, bikes are the the best way to get around. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance(Camille's for breakfast was great). The hotel offered complimentary breakfast, bagels, toast, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. which was handy. Overall, it's not fancy but clean, a great pool, and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: digby45
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the island and very much enjoyed the Best Western Hibiscus. We stayed 3 days in Jan '08. The rooms were ample, and well suited for our stay. There was a working fridge and quiet A/C - some things you can't just take for granted. Maid service did not get to our room until after 3pm daily but that was OK and didn't disrupt our stay. The included breakfast was ample. The pool and hot tub were working properly as a matter of fact the county health "pool inspector" was there doing a full inspection. I don't know if it was at the complaint of one of the other posters or other customers but I can tell you it was up and running these three days and was being used. We would look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: ledsmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to meet our daughter (and grandchildren) in Key West to celebrate her fifth wedding anniversay. Five years ago, her entire wedding party and all the guests stayed at the Hibiscus and were all very pleased, so we chose to go back there. It was very important that we stay at a place that catered to children, which it does with spacios rooms, frige, micorwave, crib, and exeptional complimentary breakfast. The other main attraction was the "heated" pool. My grandchildren are like fish and will spend most of their time in the pool. I even called to be sure the pool would be heated, and was assured it would be. Well, it wasn't heated. We could not use it. It made for a very long three-day stay. That was very disappointing. The floors of our room were so dirty that our socks were black on the bottoms!! I don't think we will go back there again, not with children. The price was very good for the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: JordanF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in December. It was clean, with a nice pool and decent breakfast. They were generous with extra towels for the pool (which we also took to a nearby beach). The hotel is very close to Duval Street, but still quite a hike to Mallory Square. For us, it was affordable ($260/night in Key West between Christmas and New Year) compared to the other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Denico
Reviews.Content: Internet wireless: Good signal Room: Clean, large, well supplied Bathroom: Clean Breakfast: Excellent selection for continental Surroundings: Walking distance to beach and Duval street Overall feelings: Excellent choice, Very clean and well maintained

Reviews.Title: “Great little getaway”
Reviews.Author: gillianp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in November just walked in and asked for best rate.at around 5;30 pm was quoted $139.00 same as the great hotel next door pressed a little further and was offered a non pool view for $117 this was just right., upstairs not on the street side so very quiet. We could just look down on the really great pool as we walked out of our large clean room the hotel is quite well worn but well kept with a good breakfast room with good choices. the breakfast at Best Western can vary this one was quite good. If you like to walk this is a really great location. Key West is quite expensive but fun lots to do and see. Take the little conch train if your feet are giving out. This is a cruise ship stop so don't be surprised at the hoards. We went down for the drive as we have done the cruise ship thing. The drive was not as spectactular as the movies make it look. The best thing about Key West is the History and architecture. There are quite a few quite drunk young men around but we decided they were local color. Saw a couple of people fall off there bikes not used to it and the roads are busy and narrow so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Best Western Hibiscus and found it to be a great hotel for the price. The landscaping is lovely, especially in the area of the pool. Our room was quite comfortable and immaculate. We also enjoyed the quiet location that still permitted us to walk literally everywhere we wanted to go. The Southernmost Point was always our last stop of the night for one last peek at the ocean before turning in. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to save on their accomodations so they can spend more in Key West's fabulous bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal, Best location, overall the best!”
Reviews.Author: JillLeeJill1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there 10/12-10/17. Not one complaint! We got there at 11am and they let us check in and get to out room, then they even let us check out late! Overall great service... nice breakfast, huge room, very helpful! A+ Thanks for the great stay... we'll be back, and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest Stay”
Reviews.Author: theunitman
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Maid service was fantastic, room was keeped in excellent condition. Front desk persons were also great, even got us our room early. Everything went just like it was made to order. Will stay there again. Thanks Key West Hibiscus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CPSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Oct. 1-4 and we were very pleasantly surprised. We stayed in a king room. It was very clean and large. The room amenities included a mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, safe, and iron with ironing board. The breakfast includes cereals, pastries, waffles, bagels, and toast along with coffee, milk, and juices. The pool is large and clean. It was only about a 15-minute walk from the active end of Duval Street. We drove in and only got the car back out to drive all the way around the island. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were also able to check in and print our boarding passes for our return flight on the lobby computer at no charge. The price was very reasonable and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: Roofie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hibiscus, having stayed for 8 days over Christmas 2006. This time, it was just my husband and I for a long weekend. The interesting part of our trip was that I was using BW points for our stay, but was unable to book two consecutive nights -- so stayed on our first night (Friday), then checked out and stayed at the Crown Plaza La Concha for Saturday -- and then back to the Hibiscus for Sunday night. Having never actually done this before, I was pleasantly surprised at how smoothly this went. Once again, we loved the Hibiscus. I have to agree with the previous reviewer -- the updates to the hotel are wonderful. New windows and shades, new carpeting and all new bathroom fixtures. The pool area has been re-done, and I have to agree...you need to be very, very careful when entering the lobby area from the pool area -- very slippery. I almost always slipped when entering (granted, I was wearing flip-flops and it had rained, but there was definitely something up in that area as it appears that the new decking dipped and water collected there...just be warned and be careful). They also have upgraded the room key cards (in the past, the cards seemed to de-magnetize on a regular basis). There also seem to be more security cameras located about the pool area and the parking area -- but I might just not have noticed it before. The rooms were spotless and well appointed. Plenty of towels and decent toiletries, microwave and mini-fridge, free package of micro popcorn, in-room safes, ice machines and a well-appointed breakfast buffet (bagels, bread, waffles, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, apples, bananas and very good mini-danishes). I think there is coffee available all day (as well as a coffee machine in the room) and free internet in the lobby with a printer. Plus free wireless in the rooms and the pool area. Another nice perk is the free parking. All hotel rooms are non-smoking but you can smoke anywhere outside. The front desk personnel was extremely helpful and the maintenance staff was always present and cleaning and fixing things. You can also get towels for the pool right at the front desk. One thing I have noticed with this property is that if you book well in advance you can score great rates....if you wait, the rates increase by a large amount. This hotel does require that you pay for your first night in advance and show the credit card you used at the time of check-in. This caused us a slight problem on our first visit in 2006 when the card I had used to make the reservation was changed from an MBNA VISA to a Bank of America American Express (not by choice), but they seamlessly credited the old card number and re-charged the new one at the time of our arrival. Not sure why they do this, but perhaps they get a large number of no-shows? not sure, but it's not really a big deal. Just something to be aware of. You can easily walk to most of old town and it's nice to return to the Hibiscus at night. There is a good convenience store right down the street next to the Blue Marlin Hotel -- very good snack bar and subs. Also, we discovered a new Cuban restaurant up Caroline Street (away from Duval) -- El Siboney. Wonderful, inexpensive food. Open daily 11 - 9:30pm -- cash only. We would definitely stay here again. Our only complaint was that on our first night, there was a large group of people that were quite loud and obviously drinking heavily. They were concentrated at one of the tables around the pool area and made quite a ruckus -- throwing each other into the pool -- yelling up to their friends in rooms surrounding the pool. Management twice had to come out to tell them to get rid of their glass beer bottles and liquor bottles. The good thing was that they obviously were either out that night or passed out in their rooms as we never heard or saw them again, but it was not as pleasant that afternoon as it was later that weekend in the pool area. Plus, I witnessed an extremely rude encounter between a customer and a member of the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff does not speak english very well, but if you try, you can easily communicate with them and they truly do a wonderful job. This woman was the rudest person I have ever seen and I was horrified by the way she spoke to the maid who kept saying she didn't understand English. I guess this same unpleasant woman did not understand that the reason there is a "Do Not Disturb" sign in your room is so that you can put this outside and then the maids won't knock and try and clean the rooms if you don't want to be disturbed (perhaps she cannot read English?!) It was quite a display of bad manners on the customer's part and I was embarrassed to witness it, especially when I know full well how hard the maids work at this place. Despite the bad manners of some of the folks that were staying there on our first night, we highly recommend this hotel -- you can tell that everyone involved cares about keeping it wonderful. It is truly a wonderful bargain in a city that can be quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “repeat customer!”
Reviews.Author: snetzel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here back in Sept/Oct 06 and I wrote a very good review. Since that time, we have moved to South Florida. We decided to take a mini vacation back to Key West and stay at the Hibiscus, this time we also took our 2 small children, ages 3 & 7. We were surprised at the improvements made. For the price, I can't imagine a better hotel anywhere in Key West. We've stayed at worse (won't mention names) that were more expensive. The lobby has been done and is all brand new, very nice. And, it appears all of the rooms have been redone. Brand new shades, all fixtures were nice, bathroom nice & spacious along with a second sink mirror etc. Even the pool area has been redone. All new furniture in the last year, along with a deck. I will mention 2 things... one, the new deck was slippery and our 3 year old almost slipped and fell twice which could have resulted in a serious accident. It didn't seem slippery to me or anyone else but just an FYI....I just had him "waddle"... Second, the breakfast area is a bit small. But, that's it. Overall, I give it 5 stars and I am actually here to book it again for when the in laws (baby sitters) come down in December. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HuskerCountry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BWH for 9 Nights on a trip to Key West. Very clean hotel with friendly staff & a great view of the large pool and jacuzzi. Location was great, close to beaches and Duval Street. Found some ants on nightstand but overall a great hotel! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: brat242
Reviews.Content: I came to Key West for a mini vacation, and this was the hotel already booked. I found it to be very clean, pool and jacuzzi were good, and the morning breakfast was great. The staff was always friendly and willing to help with any questions. I would definitely stay here again! E

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Best Western Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: lmacfsu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from low budget 2 night stay in Key West. Our room at the Best Western Hibiscus on Simonton St was excellent. The fellows at the front desk were v. friendly and professional. The room was v comfortable: large, view of the pool, additional vanity/sink, fridge, a/c worked v well. Great continental BF. Since boiled eggs were included we saved $ on breakfast. We rode Trolley then rented bikes w/ basket & locks at the motel, a great way to see KW. Saw Hemingway House, beers @ Hogs Breath, Art Exhibit at Old Customs(big red brick bldg), 1/2 Shell Raw Bar and Ft Zach Taylor all recommended. Everyone in KW we did business with were exceptionally friendly. Had a great time, can't wait to return and stay longer. Stayed 9/16 and 9/17/07. It's been over 15 years since last trip. Nice to know you can still go to KW on a budget. A great place but leave the kids home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Inn! Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SharonInFL
Reviews.Content: For the past 7 years, we have always stayed at the Hibiscus when we go to Key West. We stayed here for two nights this past Labor Day weekend, and what a pleasant surprise that they've made the place even better! The lobby area has been expanded and looks lovely. Free continental breakfast is served every morning there, and there is a computer with high speed Internet access for anyone that didn't bring a laptop. I brought mine, and was able to connect through their free wireless service. The pool has been revamped and is the cleanest public pool I believe I've ever been in. The hottub is just that...HOT! Very nice! We were a large group, and had 4 rooms. Each room was huge, ULTRA clean, with comfortable beds. Each room has a safe, hair dryer, coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave. Located just 2 miles from Mallory Square, and within walking distance to Old Town and Duval Street, the location couldn't be better. The staff are so helpful and friendly. You will not be disappointed staying at this inn!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elmo7966
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean and very well maintained, lovely breakfast included toast, waffles, cereals, boiled eggs, fruit, tea, coffee and juices. Perfect location once the car was parked up in the car park we did not get back in it again until we were leaving Key West. Rooms are very spacious and the pool is immaculately clean. Wheelchair accessable, check in and out was quick and there was no hanging around the staff very polite and keen to help. Wireless internet available (although we had problems with this) and a computer in the hotel reception for use including a printer. I don't want to promote this hotel too much as I might not get a room next year as I am hoping to go back!

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic motel”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireken
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B/W Hibiscus on the 5th july for 2 nights what a nice and friendly place to stay . From the moment we checked in the staff were friendly and helpful the rooms were very spacious & clean. The location was great with the quaint shops,bars & restaurants of Duval Street a short walk. We really did enjoy our stay at the B/W Hibiscus and key west and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at BWH”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BWH July 22nd thru July26th and cannot say enough good things about this Hotel. Location for us was excellent. Hotel was very clean(must say we did not see any ants whatsoever and neither did our friends who stayed in a room 4 doors away). We stayed in a pool view room on the second floor(no extra charge). The construction by the pool was finished. But they did start on redoing the roof the day before we left but it did not cause any problems. There were plenty of sunbeds and chairs by the pool. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definatley stay at the BWH again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Haz73
Reviews.Content: This was by far the cheapest place to stay in Key West! Based on other reviews I saw on here, I decided to book it. First let me start by saying that the construction by the pool is pretty much done. I never saw anyone working on it - I just saw one orange cone in an area that looked like some construction was recently done. The pool area was very nice - very clean & lots of chairs. The water was a little warm though (between 80-90 is my guess), considering it was 90 degrees outside w/ a heat index of 100! I never went in the hot tub, but someone commented that it was about the same temp as the regular pool. The room I happened to get was sort of a suite (Room 130). You walked in to sort of a sitting area, with a couch and 2 chairs. I would think there would be a TV out there (there was even a cable or antenna hook up out there), but there wasn't. The bedroom was on the right, with its own door. The room was HUGE! There was a dresser w/ a TV on it, 2 queen beds, a large closet & a ton of open room. It would be perfect for a family because you could close the door. There was a mini kitchen w/ a little sink, fridge and microwave, along with a coffee maker. They provide a bag of microwave popcorn & some coffee. For the bathroom, there was a sink in between the kitchen & the bathroom, and then a separate bathroom. The bathroom itself was kind of small, considering the size of the rest of the room! But, we had 4 large towels, I think 5 hand towels and 4 or 5 washclothes. There were 3 bars of handsoap and another bar of body soap. I've never seen so many towels & things of soap in a hotel (usually I need to ask for extras!). As far as the people that complained about a mildew smell - this whole room had tile floor. I'm not sure if it was recently renovated, but I thought it was a good idea in that kind of climate to not even bother with carpet. And the tile floor seemed to keep the place a little cooler. It did seem a little dusty though. The air conditioning worked great. There was a digital thermostat on the bedroom wall. We pretty much kept it around 75 the whole time. I only went for breakfast one time, but I thought they had a pretty decent spread. They had sweet rolls, cereal, white & wheat toast, frozen waffles, hard boiled eggs, bagels and a couple other things. They had a few toasters, so I had no problem with toasting my waffles. They also have a computer in the lobby with a printer, which was handy for buying Trolley Tickets. They also have tickets available at the front desk, but they only accept cash for them. The only problem with the place was we did have ants - although they were very tiny ants (that were quite quick!). There were ants on one of the bedroom walls (opposite the beds) & in the kitchen. By the second night, the kitchen ants had spread to the sink that was outside of the bathroom. I called the front desk around midnight, asking if they had a can of bug spray. Within a couple minutes, the guy came to our door with a can of ant & roach spray. We sprayed the place down & the ants were immediately dead. (And the stuff didn't smell bad either!). The ants didn't come back to the areas we sprayed, although, we ended up finding more later. Overall, I would say it's a nice place for the price. They do need to do something about the ants, but it seemed that they were aware of the problem - so maybe the maids should just get used to spraying the stuff in between guests. The next cheapest accomodations in Key West were around $50/night more, so to me it's all kind of relative!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: ecsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BWH from July 2-7. We were originally placed in a second floor room overlooking the pool area construction. I asked for a move and was given room 102. The room is large, seemed recently redecorated and very clean. The continental breakfast was very nice with hot and cold cereals, pastries, hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, fresh fruit and a variety of juices. The pool is very nice but construction of the new pool deck is ongoing. Hopefully it will be finished soon. We thought the location was fine and had no trouble walking anywhere we wanted to go. I would happily stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Trvlwme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hibiscus for two nights in mid June 2007. I picked this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. They were correct. Key West is very expensive for everything, food, lodging . .etc. It as our first time to actually stay in Key West. We had stopped here before on cruise ships for the day. The Hibiscus during our stay was going through some construction around the pool, installing a new pump system I was told by the desk clerk. The actual work area was walled off from the pool area, but the noise was still there during working hours. Our grandkids didn't seems ot mind, nor did we. The pool area itself was recently redone with new decking. Its very nice and will be much better once all the construction is completed. The pool has trees around it, but could have used more umbrellas to shade from the sun, at my age I don't want too much sun . . .the water was warm and the kids had a great time. All rooms have Wifi which worked fine for us and the hotel has a continental breakfast, which was the usual stuff. The breakfast room was very small and could be bigger, but it as nicely decorated. Our room was clean and seemed renovated . . .with new curtains and bed coverings. The shower needed a new shower head as it was a trickle . . .but we survived. The A/C worked just fine. The Best Western Hibiscus is within walking distance to restaurants. We tried Camilles for breakfast one morning , a block away, it was good, but again I thought over priced, compared to prices on the mainland. I'm sure thats part of the pricing having to truck everything in . . .We were attending a wedding at the Casa Marina which was under going massive construction. I'm glad we were at the Hibiscus. Overall I would recommend the Best Western Hibiscus to my friends going to Key West. It is a taxi ride to Mallory Square unless you are an avid walker. Taxi's charge by the number of folks in the cab and can be very expensive, check before you board the cab. . We felt safe walking in Key West and enjoyed our stay. My pictures are cloudy because I took my camera right out of the air conditrioned room into the humidity . . .sorry

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious rooms in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Blondie247772
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus motel for three nights in June 2007. On booking we requested a room on the upper level and appreciated our request being granted. The room was large, with a fridge and microwave. Unlike the earlier reviews, we didn't notice any ants invading the bathroom. The room was clean, but the decor a little tired, really what you'd expect of a roadside motel. The pool was welcoming, there was some renovation work going on beside it, which we weren't aware of, but didn't cause us any problems. Again, other reviewers have mentioned that it was salt water, but I'm fairly certain it was filled with fresh water during our stay. Breakfast was enough to keep you going for the morning, but the room tended to get a little crowded later on. The lobby also contained a PC for free internet access which was much appreciated. The hotel is located a block away from Duval Street, so is away from the main centre of Key West and the nightlife, meaning you could come home at night and not be disturbed. The northern end of Duval Street is about a 30 minute walk away, but scooters or bikes can be hired from the hotel forecourt if you don't fancy the walk. All in all, if you don't mind being away from the hub of activity and can get a good rate, I'd recommend the Hibiscus as a place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kathi316
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel for 2 adults and 2 children in Key West for under $100/night is not easy. I was lucky to find this hotel on TripAdvisor and book early enough for the $89 AAA rate. We ended up with a mini-suite over the desk. The room was large and quiet. We only stayed one night, but the kitchenette would have been great for a longer stay. I also loved that there was a sink/mirror in the bathroom and a second sink/mirror outside of the bathroom. The pool area looked inviting, but the weather and our schedule did not allow us time to try it out. Cleanliness was just average. I sat on the floor to re-pack our bags and noticed a strong mildew odor. I'm sure this is common with the kind of humidity we experienced. Also, noticed ants in the bathroom. The guy at the desk the morning we checked out was extremely helpful and friendly. The continental breakfast was well above avg. They even allowed me to take a banana and cereal box for the toddler who wasn't quite ready to eat yet. Free internet in the lobby was also a plus. If I had payed more I would have been disappointed, but at this price I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wmayhem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with another couple and it was perfect. The rooms were huge so it was perfect for two couples. The room was also clean and the staff was great. I also found them to be one of the cheapest motels in Key West. The breakfast was good and the pool was nice. It is one block from Duval Street but then you have to take a good 30 minute walk down Duval to get to the main attractions. That didn't bother us one bit because we enjoyed walking down Duval and checking everything out. Plus we were able to walk off the extra weight from drinking all that beer. The Motel also offers scooter rentals if you want to get around on that. If you don't mind walking and want to get a good bang for your buck, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “this place was great”
Reviews.Author: happygambler2
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in key west April 27 - May 4th. The hotel was everything we read about it plus. There were four adults in our party. The rooms were a good size. Beds were very comfortable. Frig and Mico were great. There was a separate vanity outside the bath which was a real plus with four adults. The water pressure was the one downfall. Changed temp. and barely enough pressue to wash longer hair. However ,everything else made up for the shower. The pool area was great (however is closes at 9 p.m. but if you go back after the hotel clerk checks it out you can stay longer because there is no gate to lock the pool area). The breakfast was also great. There was quite a variety of cereals, pastries and fresh fruits. Juices, coffee and tea also. Coffee available all the time. The free high speed internet with computer was also in the breakfast area. Now the one really inconvient thing was the cleaning staff. At least three of the seven days we were there we returned to our room in late afternoon (ready to take a nap or get ready for dinner) and the room still hadn't been serviced. We had to find the cleaning staff to get clean towels. They did not speak a word of English which, unless you speak Spanish, was a problem just telling them what you wanted. Otherwise it was great. We had originally planned to leave Key West on Tuesday, June 30th and head for Orlando but we just couldn't leave the area and the hotel was very accomodating with allowing us to extend our stay the remainder of the week and at the same rate we were getting when I booked the hotel in Oct. of last year. Yes, I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great - If You Like Walking Miles & Love Ants!”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: When the lady on reception appeared to have a bit of an attitude problem and there are ants crawling everywhere you know you've arrived at the Hibiscus. This is a hotel which has seen better days. Although the room size is huge, you'll be sharing with others - ANTS. They were all over the bathroom (picture attached). The hotel is also at the wrong end of Key West. The only thing that is appeared close to was the Southernmost marker. Woo-hoo! Everything else, such as Jimmy Buffets, Conch Train and Mallory Square are at least a 30 minute walk for a person of average fitness. This was also the only hotel during our tour of southern Florida which took the first night's money upon booking. Other nights were paid for on checkout, so don't be surprised to see a difference in exchange rate fluctuations on your credit card bill when you get back home from this dive. The hotel receptionist also seemed to have a problem with allowing me to use the bathroom in the reception! Of course, I could have used the toilet in our room, but that was too far to walk when you're in need (besides, the ants were already using the bathroom anyway!) I would recommend staying elsewhere if you're coming to Key West (which is a great place by the way!) One thing to absolutely avoid when you're here are the so-called Ghost Tours. The one we went on was a rip-off. The tour guide kept us waiting and appeared intoxicated. Take the Conch Train or spend your money on Margaritas instead! One thing to absolutely do is the boat tour out to see the dolphins in the wild. We were lucky enough to see them and one even showed off with a fish it had caught! Unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Need Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Booch
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 night stay at Hibiscus. (May 15 - 19) The pool was closed 3 of the 4 nights we stayed there because they are putting in new walkways around the pool. The pool itself was very clean and nice and the walkways will be very nice when finished. The lobby looked newly renovated which makes me think the rooms and the exterior of the building will be next. With the pool closed they gave us an additional 10% discount and offered the pool across the street at the Blue Marlin but the pool there didn't look nearly as nice. The room was showing age but still very clean and the room was huge! Great for families! I personally wanted to stay at Southernmost across the street but I waited too long to book and it was full and that's why we ended up at Hibiscus. We were not in the room that much anyway so it didn't matter overall. The Best Western website should tell people when they have scheduled renovations and offer discounts upfront. The front desk insisted they didn't know about the pool but I believe otherwise. They also didn't know if there would be other renovations so just keep in mind if you decide to pick this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location/nice motel”
Reviews.Author: mln304
Reviews.Content: Just returned from BW Hibiscus on 5/3/07. This was a really nice basic motel - really big, clean rooms with microwave & refrig in room. We spent most afternoons at the pool - there were plenty of lounge chairs. Really good location - just 1 block from Duval & about a 15-20 minute walk down to the Mallory Square area. We flew in to KW so did not have a car, but we could walk to everything. One day we rented a scooter & drove around the whole island - but all of Old Town was within walking distance. Would definitely stay at Hibiscus again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jpfitzy7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus 5 times now and it is a great hotel. The location is the best, right near Duval street. We usually arrive, park our car and that is it, walk everywhere. The Cuban deli across the street in top notch for breakfast and lunch. The pool area is king as it is completely surrounded by the hotel for privacy as well as keeping any wind out. The staff is awesome and there are no problems bringing your own cooler full of beer down to the pool, no glass and just clean up after yourself. Can't wait to head down to Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Got2GetAway
Reviews.Content: The Hibiscus is a great hotel for those who want to have a convenient location to Duval, but far enough away to avoid the commotion. The rooms are a nice size and are clean, and we got a good rate for KW. The shower water temperature fluctuates quite a bit, but other than that, no complaints. This is our second stay at the Hibiscus. They supply a continental breakfast, but we did not indulge because we wanted to try new places. Camilles, a block away, has a unique offering for breakfast and is one of our favorites. The pool is nice, but a little warm. Do not rent bikes in the parking lot. Go up 2 blocks to the Moped Hospital. Less than 1/2 price. We will book the Hibiscus when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel”
Reviews.Author: v6cutie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Much nicer than expected considering it was one of the cheaper hotels in the area. Nice size rooms, two queen beds, two sinks which came in handy, a big pool, and friendly staff. Our room was cleaned every day, always with plenty of towels. The only downside was that it was a little far from the docks and the other end of duval, so we did a LOT of walking. But, everything IS within walking distance. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for those who want a basic motel, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “really big bathroom”
Reviews.Author: thomas451
Reviews.Content: the best western hibiscus has very large, clean rooms. the bathroom was as big as one at my home! it is convenient to everything. we didn't move the car for 2 days. grounds were very clean and well maintained. the breakfast was ok, but nothing special. would definetly recommend it to anyone heading to the keys. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel great location good value”
Reviews.Author: gemelos3883
Reviews.Content: Great location. Large rooms. Very friendly front desk staff. Great free breakfast. The rooms could really use some renovations though. Our room's carpet was really dirty and the sofa was also really worn. The room was big enough for a family of four. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind the furnishings. I do think the next time we go to Key West I would rather stay in one of the many many B&B's we saw around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jross46
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at the hibiscus. it's pricey for a best western, but it's clean and quiet - two very important things to me when i travel. the location is great. a block or two from south st, and a block or two from duval. free parking. the free continental breakfast layout was decent - fruit, cereal, bagels, pastry. nothing fabulous, but decent. hotel staff was friendly. pool seemed ok, although i did not swim. rooms are a bit dark - even with all the lights on. beds are a little lumpy, but i slept fine. water pressure in the shower was nothing more than a drizzle, but again, very clean. fridge kept our bottled water very cold. air conditioner worked very well. all in all a pleasant stay. i would stay here again, and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: LetsBoogie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus for two nights in early February. Whilst the hotel itself is perfectly OK, it did have the misfortune from our point of view that we had just come down from a week staying in two excellent hotels in Canada, and this place just could not match up to similar standards. It also had the distinction of being more expensive than either of the two previous hotels (the Key West factor I presume). However, it is a good place to stay for what we needed - a family friendly place with enough parking to use as a base for having a look around Key West. The room was easily large enough for four of us, and whilst not in pristine condition was clean with comfortable beds. The second wash basin was useful for the kids, and the fridge and microwave are useful facilities in a hotel room. Very nice heated pool (salt water) in which we spent a fair amount of time - beware though if you're not good swimmers as the deep end is surprisingly deep. The adjacent hot tub was also very welcome. Overall, if you do not set your expectations too high, then you won't be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place !”
Reviews.Author: kiku621
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 4 night stay frm 2/8-2/12 in one of the 2nd flr units for about $199/night. This is the most I've spent on my stays here & could have been avoided if we had planned earlier but this was an impulse decision to escape the cold weather for a long weekend. I highly advise making your reservations a minimum of 6 months in adv for the $99 rate! I've visited Key West several times in the past 12 years & have always stayed here because of the great value, it's quiet, clean & incl a self serve breakfast. Rooms are not fancy- 2 beds & a bathroom with another sink outside the main bathroom, micro, mini fridge & safe w/key. And that's all I really ask for. There is a free computer w/printer in the lobby by the check-in desk. Staff is friendly & helpful, nice daily maid service, heated pool is clean, hot tub is bubbly. I recommend the Best Western Hibiscus as a place to stay. Walk over to the bike shop several blks down & rent a bike for $10/day, eat nearby at El Solboune & Blue Heaven, visit the Chicken Store, watch the fun at Mallory Sq., see a huge cruise ship come in or leave the dock. If you're lucky, you'll see passengers trying to figure out what to do now that their boat has just left the pier! It's not funny to them but it was to us! ha ha ha! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sis0876
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location 1 block off duval and 2 blocks from ocean it is quiet, pool area very nice and clean ,rooms clean and large. Only takes 30 min to slowly walk down duval to mallory square. The breakfast was qreat. cold cereal hard boiled eggs different breads and waffles and juice and coffee and fresh whole fruit. If you want grease eat somewhere else! I look forward to going back to key west and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: guitardenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb. 8-10, 2007. Great location, close to Duval St., but far enough away for quiet. I don't see how this is considered a1 star motel.Rooms were clean, large, staff was excellent. There is a Denny's restaurant about 4 blocks away with 24 hour breakfast, which is great after those late nights on Duval St.! The price was reasonable (by KW standards). I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: PoliticalTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family with two small kids stayed here from December 7, 2006 to December 10. We paid $121.53 a night and it was well worth it. We stayed on the second floor with a pool view. Two queen beds in our room with a fridge and sink in the regular part of the room. In the bathroom was a second sink, shower, tub, etc. The hotel had a hot tub and pool. They also just finished a complete renovation which included a new breakfast area, office area, awnings, painting, etc. The free breakfast included danish, cereal, coffee, three juices, eggs, two types of bread, and fruit. The staff was friendly and helpful. Some people will think that this is a little too far from the action of Key West. Well the action isn't outside your door, but it is only a short walk to the docks or Mallory Square. Since there was free parking in the motel lot, we ended up walking everywhere. Since you weren't in the middle of it all, you had peace and quiet at night. The only complaint, a small one, was that the carpet was not clean. When you have a kid that crawls around (1yr old) you notice these things more than the average person. An excellent place to stay overall, good value, free parking, within walking distance if you don't mind walking a little.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pahhobbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms with a couple of friends for 2 nights. The rooms are very large and very clean. The hotel staff is friendly. The pool area was beautiful and also very clean. We didn't get up in time for the breakfast so I cannot comment on that. It is quite a hike to Mallory Square and that area from the hotel. A little over a mile. There are lots of places to stop on the way, but it is a long walk back after a few adult beverages. I would stay here again if I couldn't get anything closer to downtown. The price was reasonable too. You can't go wrong staying here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: 1northgeorgia
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 2 nights in Oct. The price was great, just as quoted. We were impressed with how large the room was, not a typical motel room! Our room was very clean. And a big plus(we thought) was the bathroom arrangement. In addition to the sink in the bathroom, there was another one in the dressing area. How helpful with more than one person getting dressed. The lobby was still under going work, so the office and breakfast area was still in make shift rooms. Small but we were not bothered by this. We just took our breakfast out to the pool area. I would hope that once the lobby is completed there would be more information on the area available--such as eating places, etc. Overall, great location, clean rooms, good price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Travler_Red
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Key West Hibiscus for four nights and the Hotel and Location were both great, the rooms were big, clean, and quiet, the beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom are completely brand new. Their Main Lobby was under construction, but the Pool was great and the Jacuzzi was very warm. The Location was excellent (Didnâ€™t need the Car), it was a healthy walk (1 mi.) or a short Scooter/Bike ride to heart of Duval Street where the bars/shops are located, and youâ€™re a short two-block walk to the beach and the southernmost point sign. The Hibiscus is a Great Bargain for the price and location and Iâ€™ll definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone. BTW â€“ For breakfast go visit Camille's Restaurant that is just one block from the hotel, the food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: JYancey
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I booked my stay with Best Western Hibiscus in Key West via Hotels.com because a deposit was not required. When I went to confirm reservations with the hotel a few days before my trip, they had been cancelled due to my debit card being declined for a deposit. Regardless of the fact that I had booked through Hotels.com and a deposit was not required, the hotel would not let me book without a deposit - period. Mistee C. with Hotels.com was extremely helpful trying to get the hotel to cooperate with me, but they would not budge. They were even going to charge me more money per night to re-book with them. I stayed at this hotel many years ago, but I will never stay there or at a Best Western again. Their customer service skills are nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: abcdefghi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, but we would have liked to stay longer. I don't understand why this is a one star hotel, I am very well travelled, and I would definitely have given it three stars. Why: - The rooms are very spacious, and included a safe, a refridgerator, free wireless internet connection. - The rooms were impressively well cleaned. - The staff was friendly in a laid-back manner. - The location was great. It's within walking distance of Duval Street and the pier, which is very convenient. - The parking is free. The only thing we didn't like was that the group of party boys in the room next to us did just what they came there for - partied - which meant that the noise woke us up. But I think that had more to do with them than the hotel. Also, we were literally two minutes late for breakfast (which is included in the rate), so we didn't get any. Again, that was not the hotel's fault, but they could have given us a muffin each. All in all, I think this is very good value for Key West, and a good choice. The size of the rooms makes this hotel a great choice for families travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JEdmund
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this gets a 1 star rating. This is one of the better hotels I have stayed at. The rooms were very large and comfortable and very clean. The service was great. We were within walking distance of Duvall Street and the rates were awesome. The continental breakfast was OK but the fresh fruit made it better. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: psasquatch99
Reviews.Content: I went in February to escape the cold of Ohio for my birthday weekend, and what do I get the coldest day on record in Key West (if memory serves 32 was the over night low on one day). One of the high point was my spacious, clean room, with a very nice pool area (which only got to use one day due to lousy weather). Location was good as well two blocks south and you are on Duval Street, I recommend walking to the East Side and walking and drinking your way back. Staff was helpful in pointing out different places (Cuba market down the street, liquor store & closest bar, etc). I guy who was renting the bikes & golf cart was extremely helpful in pointing out places to eat, (gave us a tip about the AB Lobster Houses happy hour special that was great). As I have said in my previous posts I have stayed in better and worst, I would most defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beware of an unlocked door”
Reviews.Author: cowley_traveller
Reviews.Content: After having changed our room because we were assigned a room under the stairs which made it really dark, we got a pretty nice, clean and large room next to the street. We left for a day to enjoy Key West. Housekeeping wondered when we were leaving so we told her in five minutes. We left, closed the door firmly, told housekeeping that the room was ready to be cleaned. We had a wonderful day, returned to our room UNTIL... When we came back to our room early that evening, we were shocked to find that our door was LEFT OPEN! We were in a panic. Also, since our room was right next to the street, it was easy prey for anyone to wander in and help themselves. We reported the incident to the front desk (the manager had gone home) demanding that the housekeeper be asked what happened. The manager the next morning insisted that the housekeeper locked the door and that WE had kept it open. Now go figure. The housekeeper was the last one in the room. We argued this point but to no avail. We were made to feel that we were in the wrong. Whatever happened to the "customer being right"? She defended the housekeeper. As world and frequent travellers we told the manager that we always ensure that our door is firmly closed and then double-check. Nope, she still thought that we were in the wrong. In asking for compensation (a free night - what's so wrong about that with such a huge chain?), she would give us 10% off. We were shocked that that was it. 10%??? Finally, she gave us 50% off "much to her disapproval". All we wanted was a free night and that her housekeeper be told to ensure that all doors be locked when completing each room. Is that not too much to ask? So, be warned to lock your door!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hibiscus In Key West was more than I expected from a Best Western. Very clean, nice staff and close to the popular Duval Street. Breakfast each morning was run of the mill typical free breakfast. Pool was clean and attractive. If you are staying in Key West be sure to visit Fort Taylor...best beach in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Ritz but we didn't expect it to be! - Worth it!.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After many hours seacrching for a room for 6 (3adults & 3children) this seemed to match our price and requiremnts, although we had to book 2 rooms. Family rooms seem to be non-existent with Key West. Lobby construction didn't affect us in any way and you may have noticed some workers on the roof if you bothered to look for them. Whole complex was quite small but not overpowering, you could in fact say quaint. Pool was good size, hot tub HOT!!. Our room was larger than we had expected with 2 queen size beds and we actually had ample space for my family group 2 adults & 3 children (10/5/2yrs) within the rooms. Our family friend had the second room on his own!. Very close to Duval Street, which is the place to go with a visit to Mallory Sq for the Sunset. Southern most point, 10 minutes walk away but not much else there, we felt!.. Camilles across the road for Breakfast good/recommended!. However we went to 'Commodores' for dinner which is on the waterfront by Mallory Sq. felt that they didn't want us their, no childrens menu and no chicken for alternative meal for them, so after being served chilled water we left!. Back to the Motel the air con was noisy (inside room under window setup)but done the job. Overall no major complaints and would gladly stay at this Motel again!.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the BW Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: mangie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BW Hibiscus from 6/6 - 6/10 and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel was very nice for the price we paid. Nice big clean room with a comfy bed. There was a small fridge, which was nice to keep our water bottles cold and a microwave, which we did end up using. The bathroom consist of bathtub shower, sink & toilet. There is a bonus sink outside the bathroom with nice counter space & a large mirror. I was still able to get ready while my boyfriend was using the bathroom, great feature.
