The room is very basic, no frills, but big & clean. One problem was the water pressure in the shower, it was switching from hot to cold every few minutes, but it was nothing major. The continental breakfast ends at 9:00am, so get up early! It consist of bagels, muffins, cereal, pastries, coffee & juices. Nothing special, but it got us going in the moring till we had lunch. The pool is a good size with plenty of chairs for lounging & a nice hot tub, too hot outside to use though, but we did enjoy taking a dip in the pool to cool off. The location is not bad, like everyone said, it's in the quiet part of town. It was only a 15 minute walk to the other end, gave us a nice walk while hopping in & out of all the shops along Duval Street. We rented bikes for $10.00 a day, which was so much fun, we rode them everywhere. It's only a few blocks from Duval Beach Club, great food & nice little beach. I do have one big complain about the hotel staff. Wnen we made our reservation, I was told the rate would be $109 per night & 10% off with our AAA discount. We were told that once we check in, & showed our card, that we would get the discount. We'll when we checked in, the clerk took my card & said that we would get the discount. When we checked out, we were charged $109 per night. I asked about my discount, she said that there is nothing that she can do now, it was a Saturday & the auditor won't be in till Monday. She showed us that they wrote AAA discount on our bill????? She said to call back on Monday & they would take care of it then. Well, when I called, I was told that we got a manager's special rate & AAA was not available for the rate, WHAT? We were never told that at check in or check out..........BEWARE PEOPLE!!!!! She said that we already signed all the paperwork & checked out so thats it!!!!! Don't be fooled by any unadvertised specials --- I did not know we had a manager's rate. I think they just made this up, who knows. I would of stayed at this hotel again, but because of this issue with the rate, I will not stay there again. We did enjoy the hotel, the staff were all plesent during our stay, no complaints about the hotel at all, just make sure what you are paying upfront & don't be fooled by the call back Monday scam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel”
Reviews.Author: cutiger
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything bad about this motel. Room was large, and the motel is located away from all the noise of Duvall but still close enough to walk if you would like. The sevrice from the hotel staff was wonderful. We arrived in KW at noon and they allowed us to check in early with no problems or advance notice. The pool was GREAT!!! Looik foward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely like always...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in May 2006. Was the second time we took this hotel. Price was 125 USD plus tax booked via Best Western. Fair price for Key West and for what you get at the hotel. Rooms are huge. They only have two queen beds in each room. They also have a second sink in the room. Pool is huge and lovely. It is indeed very clean. Location is also good. Around 15 minutes to Duval Street if you walk not too slow. Southernmost Point is even closer. You get a continental breakfast for free and it is ok - nothing special. Right now, they have constructions going on. Therefore, the lobby is in a downstairs room and the breakfast is next to this room in a seperate room. You can pick up what you want to eat and go to your room or at the pool to eat there. Please note that we did not hear a single noise from the constructions. At the hotel, you can rent bikes what we did. 10 USD per bike. All in all, a good stay and I would come again...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DebraCo
Reviews.Content: Location was good if you are a walker. We walked up and down Duval twice a day, generally totalling about 5 miles of walking a day. Nice and quiet. The continental breakfast was substandard compared to others I have had. There were no waffle makers, and no hard boiled eggs. It was all mini, mini, mini donuts, bagels, muffins, carb central. No liquid creamer for the coffee. Coffee from the machine was pretty bad so I ended up making coffee in the room (came out much better) and keeping half and half in the fridge, which was nice to have. The hours of the continental breakfast (6-9 AM) were clearly designed to save them money, as most that I have seen end at 10 or 10:30 AM. The pool was very clean, but they could have used a few more tables with shade available. The hot tub was not too hot, which I happened to like. The room was very very large and the presence of an extra sink was really good. The only complaint was the shower. Pressure was very low and the shower kept alternating between cold-ish and hot, no matter what time of day. This made for an unsatisfying shower. The air conditioner was a bit loud and could have used an update to a digital model in order to maintain a more consistent temperature.

Reviews.Title: “more of the same..........”
Reviews.Author: westcotesgirl
Reviews.Content: having stayed two nights here on the start of a two week vacation touring around florida - we found the hotel to be excellant value for money - and our views are reflected in previous comments. Lovely pool, good service, relaxed vibe, free parking, good room - would definatley return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Key West”
Reviews.Author: luv2run64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights total. The rooms are very large and clean. The hotel staff were accomodating and the pool was clean and well maintained. The beach is two blocks away and Duval street is one block south. It takes about 10-15 mminutes to get to the heart of downtown Key West by foot, but there are stores and entertaining people to watch along the way. Hotel parking is available and free, so we just left our car and walked all over. Continental breakfast consists of a coffee and juice machines and donuts and bagels. No sitting area. Sit by the pool or take to your room. The only problem we had was a clogged tub drain, which was fixed upon our request, and a shower that went from cold to hot continously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter Week 2006, our room was on the second floor. The hotel was clean and well kept and our family enjoyed the pool. We arrived before check-in and Rita at the front desk provided a place to change, so that we could swim, until our room was ready. (very nice) The breakfast area is small, but everyone took their turn and it worked out great. This hotel is located on the Atlantic side of Key West. Close to the Southern Most Point. A block North from Duval. A Trolley stop is just around the corner if you would like a tour.Two great breakfast cafes close by, and great Cuban food across the street at Dennis Pharmacy. We have been several times and found this a great place to stay for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “good choice if you are in good walking shape and not fancy people”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: a slightly above average motel within a plus and minus one mile walk from everything at a good ( ie $160) price. we didn't figure out until the last morning that accross the street is the most southernmost and oldest pharmesy with a coffee shop bar that inspired jimmy buffet's cheasburger in paradise - bacon and eggs is $3.95 - cheesburger is $2.95 ( fries extra)- go eat there when you arrive

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bugs1012
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but have good things to say about this Best Western. ItÂ´s reasonable value for the area, the staff were very helpful, the room was a good size and very clean, and thereÂ´s free parking on site. ItÂ´s a 15 minute walk to the centre of things in Key West. We didnt try the in-house continental breakfast as we wanted to try out "Blue Heaven" which had been recommended as the place to get brunch in the Key. And it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hibiscus”
Reviews.Author: queequaig
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great experience at the Hibiscus. Chose it based on all the referrals. Since we are early risers it worked out great to eat the perfectly adequate continental breakfast and hit the streets before it got too hot. They tried to give us the room by the icemaker under the stairs, but moved us on request to #204 which was clean and nice and huge by any standards. It didn't dawn on me until later how quiet the rooms are in spite of a group that liked to hang out at the pool from dawn until late. The pool situation is the best- big pool, small motel. We liked the cuban sandwiches at the deli/grocery across the way for lunch. We asked about dinner restaurants away from Duval street, but didn't get any help; found one by luck on the bay side that was decent. I didn't think I would get much out of a visit to the Hemingway house, but it was one of my favorite things we did. We would definitely stay at the Hibiscus again. H.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, grumpy staff”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location easy to walk to most areas of the island. The hotel from the outside has a great design, on the inside it is slightly dated and basic but has everything you need. The rooms are well maintained and very clean and the pool and surounds are clean. Free parking is great as it saves a fortune. The breakfast is basic and finishes too early I am not sure why they bother to offer this as I didn't see many people using it, I got a pile of muffins and danish and took them to out room they were fine as snacks around the pool in the evening. The only downside to the hotel is the grumpy, moody, misrable staff and the fact that they take the first night in advance dispite booking direct. We found they seemed ruder to us than other people visiting the front desk, this could be because we are all young and they seemed to talk down to us. We will be visiting again next month and shall avoid the front desk as much as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shabanu2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Best Western Hibiscus. There were 8 girls total, 2 rooms, and we all loved it. The staff was helpful in giving us dinner recommendations, the rooms were cleaned daily and we loved the pool area. We never had a problem getting chairs and it was never crowded. All rooms have wireless internet, although we didnt know that and did not bring laptops. The location is great, close to Duval and right near the Southernmost Pt. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: wintergreen_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Hibiscus and must say it was great! The room was big and the extra sink outside the bathroom came in handy(we had two teenagers with us) I can't say enough about the great location, everything is in within walking distance. Pool and jacuzzi were both heated and close to all rooms. You have to try the restaurant Blue Heaven, the best blueberry pancakes! Another local favorite is BO'S, know for its unique atmosphere and awesome fish sandwiches, very Key West! Yes, I would recommend Hibiscus to anyone looking for a reasonable priced hotel close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Hibiscus is a great little place”
Reviews.Author: SKYYcamel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hibiscus from Feb. 9 - Feb. 17. It's a great little hotel and close to everything. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Our only complaint was the water pressure (very very bad). Good staff and housekeeping was very good. We rented bikes for our entire stay right in the hotel parking lot. We forgot how fun riding a bike can be. Key West is a great place to visit and the Hibiscus made it that much better. One warning I have for everyone.........avoid Capt. Mario's Seafood Buffet at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is DISGUSTING!!!!!!!! Other than that, all the other places we ate were quite good. Jamaican Me Hungry was excellent as was The Rooftop Cafe(Rooftop's Key Lime Pie is excellent). You have got to go to Flying Monkeys bar and have a Frozen White Russian. I had to have one everyday. Irish Kevin's is a very fun bar to visit. They have very good sing-along entertainers. I also highly recommend a sunset cruise. We went with FURY and they did a really good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Key West and we booked this motel based on the reviews on this website. It was exactly as described. We had four adults sharing one room and felt that we had plenty of room to spread out. The extra sink outside of the bathroom was a real plus! The pool water was very warm which was nice when the outside temp was right around 70 (a little cooler than normal). If you don't mind walking a bit then everything was very convenient. It was a nice walk to Mallory Square. The continental breakfast was below average but adequate enough to start the day (we are more lunch and dinner people.) We had the best meal of our 4-day stay at Abbondanza's which was right down the street. It was plentiful and reasonably priced for this town. We will probably return some day and will most likely stay at this motel again. GO STEELERS!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snook4Britt
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us stayed there last year on a bike (motorcycle) ride for about 4 or 5 days; it wasn't long enough ! the hotel was very nice. the front office people were great, the rooms were wonderful, & we're already planning to do it again this Sept. I have been going to Key West since I was very little & I am now 60 years old ! I would recomend this hotel to anyone I know.....thank you, Snooky

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Large Room, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy4242
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the best part of our visit to Key West! We stayed 3 nights (far too long to stay in Key West- the city was so dirty and incredibly overcrowded!). The pool was fabulous as was the hot tub. Even though it was "only" about 70 outside, it was plenty warm enough in the water for a swim and then a relaxing time in the whirlpool. Our room was very clean and very large. The two sinks (one in with the toilet and shower and the other in the room) as well as the fridge really came in handy. Along with the free parking (most hotels this close to town wanted $10-$20 a night), it was only about a 10 minute walk to the heart of town including Duval St., Mallory Square, and about 5 minutes to the Southern Most Point. IT was also an easy bike ride to the beaches. Again, Key West was not a fun place to visit but the hotel really made the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelt terribly of mould”
Reviews.Author: nealf
Reviews.Content: Your regular 2 star motel. We had booked the seniors rate - they put us in a room on the top floor and facing the street. We had 3 large suitcases and this place has no elevators! Upon enquiring for a room that was more accessible we were told we'd have to pay the full price to get them - out of neccessity we did this (not pleased with this as its the first time we've come across this type of bait and switch tactic at a hotel). The pool area is very nice and plenty of chairs to suntan and relax. Very nice setting. Many people would hang out at night and sit around there. The rooms are old, have a strong musty odour. They are VERY large though and the cleaning staff did a great job. However, they are old rooms as this motel is not new. We did have problems with the musty smell and developed runny noses as a result. This magically cleared up the day we checked out. So be forewarned. Food - the breakfast is a joke. Its a small nook (can't even call it a room, next to reception where you can get some muffins, danish, donuts in the morning before 9:00). I don;t have a problem with eating out by the pool as thats a gorgeous place to be but the food is so bad and the space so tight that its not possible for more than one person to get in. Everything except the muffins tasted terrible. If you like breakfast go to a restaurant and have a nice one. Service - apart from the cleaning staff don't expect much. When we asked for an extra blanket the clerk asked why and spent about 3 mins telling us that this was a non-standard request!! It seemed he was doing us a huge favour. Location - this is what set it apart from other cheap choices. Free parking and right next to the southernmost point. You still have to drive down to the more happening part of town, or catch a taxi ($8). But it beats living in the newer part of town which lacks character. Yes, you can walk all those blocks, we did it and it took us about an hour at a fast clip - but why would you want to? Would I stay here again - probably not as we had problems with the musty smell (mould??) in the room. People say all hotel rooms in Florida have this problem but after being down there for 1.5 weeks, staying at 4 different hotels I'd have to strongly disagree. This was the only place with a mouldy smell in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the change in reservations.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at a bigger hotel chain until I read the reviews for the Hibiscus. This place more than met my expectations. Price ($99.00) was great and the rooms were large. It was located at the quiet end of Duval St and over one street. It took 5 minutes (walking) to get to Duval and Truman and another 10 minutes to get to the other end of Duval where most of the nightlife was. If you don't mind walking and want to save a little money, try this place. Up one street from the Hibiscus was the Abbondanza restaurant. A great value, good quality, large volume place and it was busy for the quiet end of the town and during off-season. A tip; don't order an appetizer or salad, the entrees are huge. For breakfast check out the diner at the end of Duval street on the beach. The southernmost point is also 5 minutes from the hotel. The beaches are also a 10 - 15 minute walk. If you want 5-star or have 5-star tastes for a hotel, don't consider or stay here. Remember what you are paying and what you are getting before expecting the world out of a place . This place is simple, perfect for showering and laying down at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cacmlc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at this property and were very pleased with our stay. The location is perfect, as it's off the noisy end of Duval St., but close enough to walk or bicycle easily. Parking is easily accessible. The tourist area of Key West is a walking area and parking is often difficult to come by. We rented bicycles from the vendor at the hotel, mainly for the convenience, but there are lots of vendors all over the area. The Best Western's rooms are large and very clean. It was great having a fridge and microwave included. The extra sink outside the bathroom is also very convenient. We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment, but there's a small grocery across the street and plenty of restaurants within walking distance, if you don't like theirs. The pool is large (but a little chilly in November) and the hot tub was a treat after walking around Duval Street. We'd definitely stay here again (and hope to real soon).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hibiscus is a good clean motel in a decent location. The room we had looked over the pool area. It had 2 double beds and was very large, with fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The pool itself was a decent size, clean but a little too cold for me - it took me about 10 minutes to pluck up the courage to go fully under water. The hot tub was fantastic - it certainly helped me to relax after the long drive down. Aircon was effective and not too obtrusive. It is NOT 1.5 miles to Mallory Square as someone has said, and this may put some people off. It is perhaps just less than 1 mile to the very quayside. Duval street is one block over and the shops etc start after about 200 metres. The motel is convenient for Southernmost Point and the beach next to it, and also for the lighthouse and the Hemingway house. The continental breakfast is available form 6am(!) until 9am when it is swept away immediately - I don't know why they can't extend until say 10am as they must have to pour away hot coffee and throw away fresh cakes and pastries that are left at 9. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Too many ants!”
Reviews.Author: Topicalgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the first floor of the Best Western Hibiscus at the end of July 2005 for a few days. The room appeared to be clean. There was a microwave and mini-frig too. After spending time at the vanity area, I could not help but notice tiny little ants everywhere! They were all over the vanity area and walls. They were crawling into the coffee maker too! Thankfully there was coffee in the lobby! We came home with many bug bites. Their Continental breakfast was fair and served very early. The bike rental in the hotel parking lot was much more expensive than right across the street. The hotel is located at the southern end. It would be an OK walk in cooler days but July was tough. We had relatives staying on the 2nd floor that had no problems. Maybe our experience was different than others but we would choose another hotel when we return to Key West.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hibiscus Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 1313 Simonton Street, Key West, FL 33040
